Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dennis V
Reviews.Content: How could you not like Napa Valley. We stay here everytime we visit Wine Country. Hotel is located near all the action. It's only 10 to 20 minutes from all the cities and wineries up Hwy. 29. Wine tasting in lobby was very good and the staff was also very helpful. The Marriott Rewards Lounge was one of the better ones we have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott for two nights recently. It is a typical Marriott - you always know what you are going to get - so no surprises. The staff is friendlier than other Marriotts we have been to. Everyone - front desk, bar staff, housekeepers, bellhops, would always smile and say hi. It was nice to feel that they valued our business. The hotel is about an eight minute or so drive from downtown Napa. There are restaurants and shopping within walking distance of the hotel also. The hotel has a very nice gym that is open 24 hours a day, but it was packed when my husband tried to use it. We watched “My Week With Marilyn” via On Demand for $11.99, which I didn’t think was too bad. Movie prices vary widely, depending on how recent they are. One thing I didn’t like was the wine prices at the bar, which were quite a bit higher than other places we have been to in Napa. I asked for a generic Pinot Noir and was told that it would be $20 per glass! They of course had cheaper varietals, but I don’t think it’s unreasonable to expect a lower priced Pinot Noir in Napa. As a result, we only went there one night instead of two as we usually would have done. Personally, I prefer the Embassy Suites in Napa, but I’d stay at the Marriott again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service.... Terrible pillows”
Reviews.Author: cbonnette
Reviews.Content: Service at this hotel was exceptional- probably some of the best I have ever had. The cleaning crews were thourgh. The pillows and walls were paper thin and made it difficult to get any sleep!! The spa was not the greatest and I would not reccommend the hair salon.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, no big deal”
Reviews.Author: RS86
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights using rewards points so the stay was free. It's a clean hotel and a good location for sight seeing in Napa. Staff was nice, room was large and the bed was great. Wife was bummed we didn't have robes and she hated the hair dryer. Never used the spa. I can't complain for free :)

Reviews.Title: “Spa Day at Napa Marriott”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller658
Reviews.Content: My friend and I treated ourselves to a day at the spa -- massage, facial, pedicure, spa lunch, sauna, pool. We didn't stay at the hotel. It was a lovely day but overall this is not a 'destination spa.' It would make a great add on to a stay in the Napa Valley, especially if you're already staying at the Marriott, but it's not enough of a total spa to make it comparable to places that are more set up as a spa. For example, the pool is not attached to the spa and you have to walk outside through the parking lot and then through the lobby of the hotel to get there. All of the treatments were fine to good but none was exceptional. The masseuse and the facialist were very nice and professional but the pedicurists complained about management while giving us our pedicures. If I were going to Napa for a few days and staying at or near the Marriott I'd go back but I wouldn't make a day trip to this spa again. Especially since the price would be almost double what we paid since we bought through a discount coupon site.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin pillows and walls”
Reviews.Author: debaker68
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff looked and where really nice. Unfortunately remodeling a hotel that old doesn't improve the structure. Felt like your neighbor was in your room your could hear them so clearly. The Pillows! Like sleeping on a folded towel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT luxury Napa at all”
Reviews.Author: Carina C
Reviews.Content: My husband, bless his heart, tried to surprise me for my birthday. We had just moved to California and we had not had time to plan anything for my birthday. I told him all the nice places were booked up and there were not any specials on Jetsetter or SniqueAway. I normally do all the booking for trips and I research a ton. I always know where to look and how to get the best places. But he went onto Priceline and put in too much money for a 4 start. All 4 stars are NOT created equal. He knows to never use Priceline again because it never works out well. He actually OVERPAID for this place from what we could have just paid on their website. Anyway, that aside, it is located right off the highway, a terrible location with no views of anything. It is not in Napa at all, but in sort of a suburb location of Napa. We told the guy at the front desk that it was my birthday and we wanted a nice quiet room. He insisted our room was in a great location. What an idiot he was! We were facing the highway and toward the entrance where everyone walked by. We were also close to the restaurant which is a big problem. They need to install a door to the hallway on the first floor like they have ont the second floor. And they need a door that exits out of the restaurant into the first floor rooms. It is so loud. A lot of the people who also stay at this hotel tend to be partiers, especially Bachelorette and Bachelor parties. It was awful. We had a large group of people who kept running up and down the hallway yelling and laughing. These are adults mind you, who know that people are sleeping at 1:00 a.m. After calling the front desk hours earlier and nothing happening, I finally had to open my door and yell into the hallway. They were so loud they didn't even hear me yelling. I yelled even louder a second time and they finally heard me. We felt like were in Cancun spring break hell! Where was management during all these hours of yelling and frolicking? It is the middle of the night and front desk didn't care. So in the morning we asked to be moved. The lady at the front desk was great and found a quiet room on the second floor, thank god! That second night we finally got to sleep. Rooms: The rooms are nothing but small normal hotel rooms. One sink in the bathroom, very small bathroom. Nothing fabulous at all about these rooms. My husband felt so awful because this was just not up to our standards at all. If we had been driving on some road trip and needed a place on the side of the highway, this place would be fine, but not for an event in Napa where it is supposed to be beautiful and relaxing. A major problem was housekeeping. That first morning, after getting no sleep, we got a knock on our door at 8:30 a.m. saying, "housekeeping.". What the he** is housekeeping doing knocking on doors at 8:30 a.m.? That is way too early and the management needs to fix this! This is not some business hotel in San Francisco where people are out of the rooms by 8:00 a.m. This is a vacation destination. Food: We purposely avoided eating at the restaurant because we knew it would be sub-par restaurant food. We were so tired that evening and my husband wanted to watch the March Madness Semi-Final game. They had TV's so we decided to just grab something light and watch the game. That was a mistake, ick. Anybody who says this food is good has no idea what good food tastes like. That is all I am going to say about that. Anyway, we will be returning to the Napa and Sonoma Valleys, but we will not stay here ever again. We will wait for some specials at some nice resorts, or we'll just pay up for the experience we want.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pfawn
Reviews.Content: This is a great FS Marriottt. The restaurant is AMAZING!! The best hotel restaurant that I have ever tried. Even the food in the concierge lounge was fantastic! After staying in Marriott properties for 3yrs, this is the first property that recognized my request for extra towels (it is on my Marriott account) withput me asking forbtowels. It is also convenient to most of the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Becoming more than a Motel”
Reviews.Author: longhornwine
Reviews.Content: This property has a lot going for it, despite it's appearance as any other motel. The location is excellent; it's on the main Hwy 29, with each access to Napa town conveniences and the wineries up-valley. A recent renovation has provided comfortable, new beds and nice rooms. The club lounge is very nice, with great breakfast and nice desserts. And the lobby restaurant has excellent food at bargain prices! There's a Starbucks kiosk in the lobby. They even have local wineries pouring free tastings in the lobby......a nice touch. However, they charge like they're an upscale resort, and don't even think about an in-room movie - unless you're ok with a $17 charge!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeAway44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in December. It's close to downtown Napa and a short drive to many wineries. We received complimentary wine tastings at 4 wineries upon check-in as part of a special promotion. The hotel also offers wine tasting in the evening but we were never there to participate. We really only used the hotel for sleeping, and the bed was very comfortable. There are nice amenities like a pool, jacuzzi, spa, and fire pit, but again, we were too busy exploring Napa to be at the hotel much. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1919
Reviews.Content: The lobby and hotel bar are well decorated. They have a wine tasting happy hour for guests which is fun. The rooms are pretty average. However, what makes this hotel so great is the staff. Everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to help! I haven't encountered such a great and friendly hotel staff in years!!! Made you feel at home and very special. The hotel also has a free shuttle that you can use to go to and from dinner!

Reviews.Title: “good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: AlohaHonolulu
Reviews.Content: Hotel recently renovated and the lobby is more "hip" and "chic". Bar and restaurant good; rooms are just average. Bed very disappointing and uncomfortable. Hotel doesn't seem as warm and friendly as before; that said, it's a great location and if you can get a good rate this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TKD1BB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for a business meeting and was pleasantly surprised. The lobby, room and outdoor patio are all remodeled and very modern. The bar/restaurant as well had that Napa vibe. Staff was very nice. Wine tasting at night, was a nice touch - not really a happy hour, but still. Restaurant food was well done, considering you don't usually expect good food at a Marriott, but they did a nice job for our table. For those of you who are tech savvy, if you check in there on the Foursquare app, and show the front desk, you can get two complimentary tastings at Viansa, which is a nice perk. Room was quiet, because I asked for that - as the hotel does front on the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Poohh66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about a year ago and being Gold Reward Members of Marriott we usually try to stay at Marriotts since we are almost never disappointed. We returned this year and found the lobby to be very nice (it was under construction a year ago) The bar/restaurant by the lobby stays loud all the time, but ok for a quick meal. You hear everything that happens in the halls, at all hours of the night. The concierge lounge was very disappointing, DO NOT pay extra to get use of it, it is not worth it, the breakfast pastries were all terrible, dried out and tasteless, my husband had the eggs and he said they were just ok, the only other thing you will find is some fruit, yogurt and granola cereal. The coffee is pretty good and strong, and available pretty much all day. The other thing that I found disappointing was the smell, when you walk in it smells like a cheap motel, not at all what I am used to expecting even from the lower chain of Marriotts. We might return because it is in a convenient location or because we have points to apply toward stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but Loud”
Reviews.Author: jennherlihy
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't look like your typical Marriott outside. However, don't let the exterior fool you. It is actually really nice inside and offers your typical Marriott comforts. The hotel also has beautiful grounds and a decent restaurant. The hotel service was great. They allowed me a late check-out, without much fuss. I really wish I could give it 5 stars. However, my husband and I stated for the Napa Valley Marathon. The hotel was obviously quiet full as it was the designated race hotel. We were on the first floor and I really had quiet a bit of trouble sleeping (which is not typical for me). I felt like I could hear everything outside our front door --- from doors opening and closing to people talking on the landing 30 feet away. This is a fairly common issue at hotels. I'm not sure why. It seems like with a bit more insulation, weather-stripping and a better front door this wouldn't be an issue. As nice as this place was and as much as I wanted to like it . . . if I can't sleep because of noise levels I simply can't recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “All-around great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GachGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott fans, so when we planned our annual Spring Break trip (we're both teachers), we knew the Napa Marriott was our top choice. The hotel is in a great location, right off Highway 29, so getting to most of the vineyards took no more than 10 minutes with traffic. I will say that there may be more quaint places to stay in towns like St. Helena or Rutherford, but this Marriott has wonderful amenities like a great gym and lobby where they have a complementary wine tasting every day from 5-6. The rooms are clean and basic, but have some very comfortable beds. To sum it up, this Marriott is nothing original, but a fantastic hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Through and Through”
Reviews.Author: RandomTraveler88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in town on business and thought this measured up very well with any of the other hotels I've stayed at. The staff was very friendly and attentive, the rooms very comfortable and I had a great dinner at the restaurant. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for New Years”
Reviews.Author: loveeatingineurope
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for New Years 3 years running. I like the renovations and the staff. They also have NYE festivities that I have never taken a part of but love seeing all of the people enjoying themselves. The lobby has a great place to eat and drink. There are TONS of place to eat and drink in downtown Napa including Morrimoto's, and other celebrity chef restaurants the you will love. Make it happen any time of year. Great place, great location. I'm up here often and don't even stay overnight. Try it for yourself. The Napa Valley is unlike any other place you will ever visit. Ask me questions, I can help!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: scotiasunny
Reviews.Content: This place is truly a wonderful place to stay while touring around Napa Valley. We are a couple in our late 40's early 50's. Blossom, who works at the front desk was so pleasant and helpful. The staff are so friendly and willing to please, especially, Dominic who works in the concierge section. She new her stuff, gave us two for one wine tasting vouchers, suggested places to have lunch, check out, Brix and Auberge Du Soleil (must sees) and she even ask how we made out the next day. I recommend upgrading to the concierge service as it has perks: light breakfast, appetizers late afternoon,desserts in the evening, free wine tasting on the weekends and wine tasting every evening out in the lobby too! Did not use the pool however, it looked nice. The Spa was truly amazing, best massage ever, even had lunch brought over from the grill. The rooms are very clean, always a full supply of towels, and the king bed was very comfortable. A fridge was located in the room, could have been a tad bit colder. The grounds are very nice as well as there are outdoor gas pits and gas heaters to enjoy the outdoors in the evening. The food was very good, however, would have like to see more choices, as it's like a upscale pub. The highlight of the whole trip was the castle, "Castello di Amorosa", ask for Tim, very knowledgeable, great humor, plentiful wine tastings, he made the trip. This is a MUST, you can collect a two for one voucher located at the Spa, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Marriott”
Reviews.Author: LovetoScuba
Reviews.Content: This is not the fanciest Marriott we have stayed in, but the staff is amazing. Blossom (at the front desk) checked us in and made us feel so welcome. Blossom also promptly responded to a problem we had with a rowdy neighbor one night. The walls are pretty thin between the rooms which is always annoying, but seems unavoidable when staying at hotels. The rooms are very similar to what we expect from a Marriott - clean, well-appointed, comfortable for a small room. We had access to the concierge lounge (Gold Elite) where we had breakfast each morning. This is one of the few Marriotts we have stayed at where the lounge is open all week. Breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs w/cheese, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, bread, bagels, cereal, yogurt, and juice. It was the same each day. The evening hor d'oevres were nothing earth shattering, but nice for a quick bite after a day of wine tasting. One night Rutherford Hill was pouring in the lounge and gave us free tasting tokens to be used at the winery. There are also wineries pouring in the lobby each evening. Dominique (in the lounge) obviously loves sharing her knowledge about the region and provided valuable information as well as tasting passes for several wineries. Every staff person we came across was smiling and seemed genuinely pleased to be there. This Marriott should definitely be proud of the image their staff gives to their patrons!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel. Average price for the location.”
Reviews.Author: tiglao
Reviews.Content: For the price of $280/night.. It is A-okay. It is Napa.. so that is cheap comparing it to Villagio or Bardessono. It was a girls' gone "wine" weekend and there were 4 of us. The room is spacious. I like the vanity/office table in the room where we can apply makeup sitting down (important!).. and get your hair did by your BFFs (More important). The outlets are accessible.(Most important!!!) I can also say that the roll-out bed was quite comfortable.. or is that the wine making me comfortable. I can't recall...

Reviews.Title: “Standard, Updated Marriott, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: ksNOLA
Reviews.Content: It's obviously an older hotel but has recently received some good updates. The lobby, courtyards and rooms are very nice now. The one thing they can't as easily change is the location...next door to a gas station, looks at the main highway and is not in walking distance to anything. The staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful. Their are courtyards with fire pits and dining options. The concierge lounge (I'm not sure what you need to be able to use the lounge) offers continental breakfast daily; but we didn't take part in it b/c there are so many breakfast places to go outside of the hotel. There are complimentary wine tastings in the lobby from 5pm - 6pm each night. There is a gorgeous bar/lounge in the lobby, with a restaurant but we didn't ever order food. If you're spending most your time in the city of Napa this hotel location is fine; but if you plan on spending most of you time in surrounding towns then you might find a better location. The only reason we'll stay here in the future is if we book with points again. There are just too many quaint places to stay in the valley!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: HAYS_TRAVELER
Reviews.Content: Best part of this hotel is its location! It is right on the outskirts of Napa. Nothing fancy here, but they are very friendly and the ammenities are good. Nice pool area and the spa is great. Had a massage from a guy (can't remember his name now) that was one of the best I have ever had (and I get them a lot).

Reviews.Title: “Really good starting point”
Reviews.Author: ButchChicago
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. On the outskirts of Napa, right on the main road that takes you north to St. Helena and all the good wineries. For that reason alone it is a good choice. We've stayed at B&B's before, and some boutique places, and there are a lot to choose from in the valley. But rather than take a chance.. it's a crapshoot sometimes... we went safe. The food at the hotel is nothing to brag about, but we felt that we weren't there for food.. there are many options all over. The rooms were also just ok, but good enough. We were there for exploring. The bar is a good place to wind down, and there is a nice outside firepit. But the overall value is good and the location is perfect. The concierges were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Goldendogs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a business trip. Staff was top-notch; very eager to please... almost to the point of being overly-friendly, but maybe we're just not used to true customer service anymore, which is why it seems so unusual. The room was extremely clean and comfortable. Amenities were nice, including a refrigerator in-room. Room was larger than some I've stayed in. The courtyard surrounding the pool was absolutely lovely, particularly late afternoon as the sun went down. I maintain that any property that charges for in-room internet access is ripping people off and would like to see this practice stopped. We've reached a point where the internet is so prevalent and part of what we do every day that charging for it is really over the top. And it seems like the pricier the property, the more they charge for this service. Just stop with this; really mars the experience of staying at a property, in my opinion. Why not just charge for viewing the television or by the flush for the toilet! The internet issue aside, I recommend this hotel whether visiting on business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: marajoe
Reviews.Content: Great Marriott. I have stayed here many times. This is a great place for business or bring your wife here. They have a Spa. I did not use it, but looks very nice. Very helpful staff. Right in Napa. We had a driver pick us up each day. I would not recommend our driver. He had nothing to do with the Marriott. We set it up by ourself. Give it a try. I think you will love this place. Downtown is min away. Lots of good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: dcoalr
Reviews.Content: This two story property is located near downtown Napa, parallel to the Napa Wine Train route. It is clean, and has a nice concierge lounge. The spa is good, the massage I had was fine. All in all, it was a grade B experience - nothing disappointing, but it didn't blow me away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: kazkey
Reviews.Content: The price is right, so this is one of the best values in Napa if you aren't looking for a lot of character. The hotel restaurant/bar was fine for the afternoon wine reception and breakfast. The room was clean and functional, but basically just another cookie-cutter chain hotel. That said, we only paid $134 for the room, and the location was convenient for hopping on Route 29 to tour Napa, so I really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was a nightmare...”
Reviews.Author: colibrime
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself wasn't bad... but the bed had ZERO support it was like a bag of stuffed with shredded foam and no springs. I do not suffer from any back problems whatsoever but that night I was woken up at 3AM with a sharp pain in my lower back..... it was more like excruciating! It took me a month to recover and not feel any pain when I moved. I will NOT be back. I only gave the two stars because the lobby/bar/staff were great and lived up to the ratings here online. I picked this hotel because of that. This was not an isolated incident because another person in my party had the same experience on another bed. We are both slender too so it's not like we needed alot of back support. We slept terribly and had to get treatment for our backs when we got home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated”
Reviews.Author: RubyAZ12
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel. The renovation of the public areas was really nicely done. We are platinum with Marriott, so we are used to being treated very well at their properties, but the staff here went way beyond friendly and helpful. The check in process was very pleasant, the concierge lounge was well appointed, and the concierge inside the lounge was great. She gave us lots of passes to some great wineries for free tastings. The best part of the hotel though was the restaurant in the lobby. The soup was out of this world, and the meatballs were fantastic. Again, the service was over the top. We rarely eat at hotel restaurants, especially in a place like Napa, but this place is a destination in itself. The rooms are not terribly large, but well appointed with really comfy linens. The fitness center was good. They were also running some good spa specials, but we didn't have a chance to take advantage of them. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and affordable Napa hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurel R
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here last weekend and it was a very pleasant stay. The pool was heated to 82 degrees which meant the kids were able to splash about for many hours, even though the outside temp was in the 50s! The rooms were recently remodeled if a bit small. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Super kid friendly vibe too.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice.”
Reviews.Author: emersonkz
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in Napa, near to everything. Good place to stay with family and very nice spa. Two years ago we stayed in Westin Napa (great also), but this Marriot have better cost-effective. And was free wine tasting in the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent satisfying experience at this renovated Marriott”
Reviews.Author: traveltime54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have exclusively stayed at Marriott properties for the last 25 years, and have been to over 150 properties worldwide. We were a bit skeptical about this one as we approached the hotel in Napa it being quite unusually a two story hotel much unlike the typical high rise Marriott properties. The outside was one thing, but the inside was a real pleasant surprise. Recently renovated the hotel looked really good, and the suite we were given by the Front Desk Manager was perfectly outfitted, very clean, and had all of our extra requirements that we had previously ordered. The housekeeping staff who handled our room were just superb. What was also quite nice was the very large concierge lounge with a full lineup of dry cereals, juices, bagels and other breads, butter, jelly and even peanut butter, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, and fruit. Couldn't ask for anything more. Of special note was the wonderful hotel concierge Shari who was highly knowledgeable about wineries and places to eat in Napa and Sonoma. She gave us maps, comp wine tasting cards, and even mapquests to various locations. We spent some time with her really delving into the ins and outs of Napa, and it surely enhanced our experience. This Marriott is definitely first rate given our long time experience with Marriott, and without question we will return to this property when we next venture to the Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Marriott”
Reviews.Author: KerryKA
Reviews.Content: We love Marriott hotels and normally try to book with them. The beds, linens and service are great. The staff was informative in terms of helping us to select a good wine tour.

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel in napa”
Reviews.Author: newfoundwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Booked a Travelzoo deal for this hotel for $140/night that included access to the concierge lounge (breakfast, snacks, beverages, and dessert each day), free wine tastings at four vineyards (Sterling, BV, Acacia, and Provenance), a free bottle of wine (BV Chardonnay), 20% off spa treatments, and 10% off the hotel's restaurant. The hotel offers free wine tastings every evening. The hotel is incredibly close to all of Napa Valley. The hotel's gym fills up completely in the mornings which made it difficult on certain days to get a workout in. The hotel room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Recent renovations make for a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Bibiarena19
Reviews.Content: Nice restaurant, style, work out facility, spa, proximity to wine country and vineyards. Whole foods close by as well as Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good food and easy location.”
Reviews.Author: Travel4us22
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on a travelzoo deal that included some tasting passes to local wineries. We were on the concierge level and the rooms were very clean and bright and we had a nice view of a fountain below us. The location is great, easy to find and right off the main road into Napa and Yountville. Don't expect views of the grapes here, but a normal Marriott hotel. Lots of parking. There is a CVS, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods and an amazing Italian deli just on the other side of the road. Don Giovanni's, a great Italian restaurant is less than 2 miles up the road as well. The staff here are all very nice, free wine tasting from one local winery each night from 5-6pm, and the food is very good with reasonable prices. We really enjoyed the chicken lettuce wraps and duck salad we had at the restaurant very much, seasonal, fun and fresh. The concierge lounge was very crowded while we were there, it was hard to get a seat for breakfast with so many people there. Only two toasters, a line of people and food flying out as fast as they could restock it. It would be nice if they had trays to take food up to your room as it was so full the Friday morning we were there. The evening appetizers and desserts were nice and it was less crowded at that time. They served cheese, olives, quesadillas, focaccia bread with blue cheese and pears the night we stayed. Desserts were assorted cake slices. We thought the property was clean, well staffed and very nice. I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Good”
Reviews.Author: CandyManMia
Reviews.Content: This is a basic Marriott; similar to a Courtyard. The people are very friendly and service is attentive. Make sure you stop to meet Shari the Concierge, she is one of the best (seriously); she really knows her stuff and enjoys what she does. You can read and plan all you want but she is the "maven' for Napa and vecinity. They had wine tastings from 5-6PM in the lobby, the sampling is good quality.

Reviews.Title: “The Marriott was great for my best friend & I :)”
Reviews.Author: fashiongirlnyc
Reviews.Content: It was a girls weekend away...we met up with a group of friends & the location is perfect and easy to find when coming in from San Francisco. The hotel room for 2-2 beds is a good size. Basic amenities...Wireless not included but only 5.00 a day. I would stay here again and book a spa treatment in advance :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, and Price”
Reviews.Author: richarddavis2020
Reviews.Content: Used the Napa Valley Marriott Hotel and Spa as home for 5 nights during December 2011 wine tasting vacation. Booked concierge class room from Marriott web site at a very appealing rate. Check in, room, service staff, and concierge ammenities were all delightful. Decor is upscale, but not pretentious. Room was clean and maintained well. Location is hard to beat when exploring the valley. This hotel is an excellent option.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good stay at a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: knitgrl
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Marriott on our last trip to Napa because it was our most reasonable option. All the places we tried to book were either very expensive or fully booked for our dates and we'd rather spend our money in Napa on dinners and wine than hotel. What makes this hotel such a great deal is the staff. From our check-in with Blossom at the front desk to the concierge and the staff in the breakfast room, everyone was friendly and helpful. We had requested a quiet room and the first room they gave us wasn't, but they gave us 2 other options and one room was perfect. The rooms are fine for the type of hotel and it was a nice perk to have breakfast included. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Day at the Spa”
Reviews.Author: SaraDuane
Reviews.Content: Bought facials,(30 minutes) full body massage( 50 minutes), and scalp treatment as a 60th birthday present for self and spouse, the staff forgot about us while we waited to be called in, until I walked out to the front desk in my robe asking about our services, they stated when I booked the treatments that a glass of champagne was included, had to ask for it, facial entailed a scrub, no mask, they poured some sort of smelly oil inside my hair as the scalp treatment, barley felt the focus on specific muscles, the massage was all generalized, and shorter than the 50 minutes I had booked us for. Would definitely NOT recommend this day spa to anyone, very mediocre! We did not stay the night in a room so no comment on that...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Newly Renovated”
Reviews.Author: AlisonSaskatchewan
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by Blossom at the front desk, she was Efficient, Kind and Very Funny! She is a Star Employee, who was helpful. We were celebrating a Special Occasion, and she directed us to a Fabulous restaurant that 1st night, she really set the stage for a memorable wk in Napa. The rooms in this hotel are newly renovated, they were clean, with comfy beds, flat screened T.V.'s and the outstanding Bath and Body Products. We were given tasting coupons fo several Wineries, very nice of the Hotel. Wine tasting each night at the Hotel between 5 and 6 was included, and than you could sit by the pool and relax, such a nice setting. There is also coin laundry which proved useful. The gym was nice, but took the opportunity to run outside as the weather was warm. The concirge Level Room was worth the money as it comes with Many extra perks. I would stay at this Hotel again, great location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again if I could help it!”
Reviews.Author: jaizee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently because we wanted to go to Napa, but we made our plans rather late and most of the other hotels were either sold out or really expensive. We figured that a Marriott would be at the very least a standard, acceptable hotel room. We were disappointed by the room - it didn't feel like a standard Marriott room at all - it felt just a little bit better than a motel room. The room just felt old and dated, and gave me a bit of the "icks", even though it was mostly clean, I guess. And we paid $350+ for our "almost-motel" room. The shower quality in the bathroom was so poor that I had trouble rinsing the shampoo out of my hair. Other points: service was fine, nothing special, although they had to be reminded about a couple of things regarding our check-in. Location is also fine if all you want is a hotel within a short driving distance to the main wineries. But it's not a charming location at all - near some strip malls right off the highway. Basically, there is nothing special about this place that would make it worth it to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodeled lobby”
Reviews.Author: travelerlpl
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time that I been to the Napa Marriott. It is convenient to the wineries of Napa Valley. The concierge always has complimentary or 2-4-1 tasting coupons so stop by there before venturing out. The lobby has an upscale feel with a beautiful gas fireplace in the sitting area. Wine tasting in the lobby is also included every evening from 5-6. There is also an outside sitting area with a firepit that has comfy couches and chairs. I stayed on the 2nd floor looking at the pool. Not the most quiet location. People were in the spa til 10:30 at night and their voices were easily heard from my room. My recommendation would be to stay in a room facing the landscaping off to the side of the pool instead. That is where I was originally, however, the thermostat wasn't working so I asked to be moved to another room. Bath and Body products were complimentary along with tea/coffee in the room. There is also a small fridge and safe. Beds were comfy except I would have liked better pillows. All in all, a nice stay and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott is a good place to stay when in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: BacktoBoston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel for four days and found it to be a good place to start our vacation- the perfect base for our ventures in the valley. The hotel was packed with Napa Valley wine tasters yet the service was very good. The room was fairly large and very clean. (Every Marriot property I have stayed at has always been very clean) We had a first floor room with access to the garden courtyard. The chairs outside our room gave us an opportunity to try some of the wine we had purchased. The hotel’s location is a key reason to select it. It is located right off RT 29 and within walking distance of a Starbucks, Trader Joes and Target. It’s just a short drive to Rutherford and Yountville with their well known restaurants like Mustards and Ad Hoc and wineries like Mondavi and BV. And, it is very easy to get to the Hess Winery and to the Carneros Highway that will take you to Sonoma. We had breakfast at the hotel and the food was good. We talked to other visitors who had also had dinner there and they were pleased, if not surprised, with the quality of the food. If you decide to spend more time at the hotel, there is lots to do. You can participate in the wine tastings, visit the Spa and Salon, use the fitness room, sit around the fire pit at night and swim in the pool. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. The property is very nice and the rooms were clean and reasonably priced for Napa Valley. The staff was very pleasant and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: TigerVic
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here. Was a toss up between Westin Verasa and Marriott. But Westin is much more expensive. Marriott was a better choice as it turned out. Check in was no fuss - and we had our keys in minutes. We booked the Concierge Level room...and the carpets were new - and the bed was so comfortable. The room came with access to a private lounge which served drinks, breakfast, PC internet access and newspapers. Not bad, except that the lounge smelt a little stale as we entered. This can be improved. Checkout was efficient - and we were on our way along the St Helena Highway to the wineries. Across the highway - was the shopping centre with Target and Whole Foods. Quite convenient with the car. Parking was free and ample. We took a room with a King size bed and a rollaway bed came complimentary for our son. The room was spacious - and would recommend friends to stay there. We went on the Wine Train which was located right across from the Westin. But for the price, I think we did better with Marriott unless you wish to pay a lot more just to be across from the Wine Train station.

Reviews.Title: “Got a special deal and thought it was great!”
Reviews.Author: scrambler329
Reviews.Content: We went there this summer and thought for the price it was a good deal. If you are looking for a resort type property that will not break the bank this is it. Location is away from attractions so you need to drive pretty much anywhere. Rooms were fine and updated. On site food is nothing special but not bad either. Pool area was spacious and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Nice amenities, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: RetroStewardess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott recently for a conference. Got a great rate on Travelzoo, which included wine tasting vouchers, a spa coupon and a bottle of wine on check-in. Although this is a large property, the staff was friendly which made my stay enjoyable. Room was clean, and included a safe to store valuables. I was in meetings all day, and didnt venture out to go winetasting, so i dont know how close the wineries were to this property. But if I'm in Napa again for pleasure, i would definately consider this hotel. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: nowinsf
Reviews.Content: Expensive for what you get- a sub-$100/night room anywhere else but Napa. Inconvenient lay out in what appears to be a renovated motel. Not impressed by the concierge or the "concierge level" amenities. I've had better lounge food at a Comfory Inn. Good location though and pretty clean (if very dated) rooms. Unfortunately I'm realizing that there's not a whole lot of alternative for a "big" hotel unless you're willing to pay significantly more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Indytravelinggrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Napa Sept. 2011. It was my first trip there. We stayed in the Marriott which turned out to be perfect. I understand they have recently remodeled and it was a nice hotel. As with any Marriott, the beds were awesome, the room clean and the service friendly. The location is great but it is not in an area where you can walk to eateries,shops, etc. This was ok with us as we rented a car. Overall,I liked this hotel a lot and would reccommend it, especially to Napa first-timers. Yes, there are quaint, cute, small hotels and B&Bs out there, but for someone who wants to ensure a comfortable stay while traveling, this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring the valleys”
Reviews.Author: la_Vino_Chica
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with business associates and found this a lovely place. It's at the southern end - true there's not a lot around, but it's a good quiet spot to make your homebase. Carneros & Sonoma are just a quick drive away. The bed was very comfortable and made with nice linens. The bathroom was very clean, with a small tub and nice shower. My basic room was plenty large to spread out and relax. I was at the end of the hall, but found things to be very quiet. Wifi and breakfast are not included -- budget travelers should be aware of that. The bar area is nice - making it a good gathering place for groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dan7482
Reviews.Content: Great location, right off the highway makes for easy coming and going up and down the valley. Also offers a large bar and Starbucks inside, so it's great for early mornings or late evenings. A classy concierge breakfast was great in the AM, and very comfy beds with brilliant showers.

Reviews.Title: “Best service of any Marriott”
Reviews.Author: totajohn123
Reviews.Content: Everyone is so friendly and helpful. I have not had such helpful service at a full Marriott as this. Concierge lounge options are plentiful and the staff there are really do anything the helps the stay be what you want.Great location for access to wineries with Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Starbucks, and Peets in same shopping center across the highway. Andretti's wine tasting with excellent range of olives for nibbling in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not have asked for a better staff”
Reviews.Author: Schollat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott last weekend. I planned on proposing to my girlfriend in Napa and as part of that I wanted something special in the room when we arrived. Laura and Jan took excellent care of me. They ordered beautiful flowers, a bottle of Champagne, and had special chocolates that I had sent to the hotel out and ready. Although we didn't get a chance to explore the spa or much of the hotel. The lobby area, bar, and outside seating was really nice. My only complaint was that there was not enough parking. We ended up parking around the back of the building and our room was in the front. They staff my engagement very special and I thank them very much!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: johnpfoley
Reviews.Content: Nice room,lovely pool, good bar,very good service.What more could you ask for? We only stayed there for one day but in that short time had the best burger that I have had in a long time and we were so full in the evening that we could only manage a duck salad. It was gorgeous. It is so great to be able to enjoy great food outide the constraints of a building. Comingfrom England we do not get many opportunities to do that but when we do and the food is of this quality it just adds to the enjoyment of it all. Would have liked to have spent more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and great value”
Reviews.Author: SergeiinSLO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Marriott Hotel and Spa for 3 days in late October. The room and bathroom are completely new and it appears the lobby and other areas are as well. Service was prompt. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was very good. The location is close to the many new and very good restaurants in downtown Napa and of course Hwy. 29 wineries and restaurants. Great price by paying in advance non-refundable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Spot”
Reviews.Author: JP-NYCDFW
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was very good. The rooms, the service, the price, the club lounge; everything. I would definately recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms; excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: PhilipGV
Reviews.Content: Great service, very nice rooms, restaurant service was exceptionally attentive but not hovering. Food was very good. Outstanding appetizers (asparagus and fried chick peas), very tasty salads, excellent main course (both fish and lamb meat balls). 2 appetizers, 1 salad, 3 dinners = $100. Very reasonable for the area. Outstanding experience. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Sandy817
Reviews.Content: We purchased a wine tasting package here that included tastings at 4 Napa wineries - including Sterling & BV - two of our favorites. We received a bottle of Beringer's when we checked in & discounts on the restaurant. We had a lovely steak sandwich lunch on the patio. We upgraded to the concierge level and had great snacks/desserts/bottled water/cokes one day and what amounted to a full breakfast the next morning. We also enjoyed the Hess wine tasting in the evening. This hotel is lovely and quiet and in a great location for wine tasting in the Napa Valley. Everyone in the hotel gave great service in a friendly CA way - and we loved it! We would stay here again and definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Not a Spa”
Reviews.Author: Hannah99Usa
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. We enjoyed the free wine tasting offered every evening. We also upgraded to the concierge level and it was worthwhile. We especially enjoyed the homemade granola for breakfast. My husband thought they did everything well, but still found the place a little cold and corporate. The only problem was with the spa. They call themselves a hotel and spa. The spa is privately run and closes at 6 PM. We never go inside. No pampering this time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for visiting the area”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoape
Reviews.Content: The location is easy to reach, right off the Rte 29 expressway. A complete shopping mall is across the road for convenience. The reception staff is excellent--effecient and helpful; often it was easier to get info from them than to wait for the concierge to be available. The rooms (there are 2 floors) are built around the perimeter and either face the parking lot or the interior patio area. While I suppose a view of the patio would be preferable, we had no complaint facing the lot; there was a row of shrubs separting the room from the lot and there was no noise from the parking lot. The room itself was pleasant, nothing out of the ordinary but kept very clean. There are interior hallways leading to the public areas which consist of a bar/restaurant and large outside patios and a pool. Food was fine for a quick bite. At 6 o'clock, one of the area wineries would have an on-site wine tasting and the hotel had some limied snacks such as a dish of olives. The concierge was helpful providing menus from area restaurants, maps of wineries, reservations, etc. Never seemed to tire of being askd the same questions a thousand times a day. All in all, a nice place to stay but like other lodging in the area, high priced for what you get. Tip: On Fridays and Saturdays, the hotel provides transportation to and from area restaurants. Its great if you are going to where parking is tough to find (or you want to drink and not drive!)but returning to the hotel can take some time.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for Napa”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine198
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a friend's recommendation. The location is good, and the staff was very friendly. The room seems a bit outdated although it was quite spacious. There is a wine tasting in the evening which is a nice extra perk. Overall, a good deal for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravlinTXFamily
Reviews.Content: The lobby and common areas of this property are very nice and close to resort quality. I was pleasantly surprised. The location is perfect for driving to various wineries. We did a wine tour with Beau Wine Tours that was exceptional. The rooms are nice and clean but nothing fancy. The bathrooms could be nicer in terms of quality but they are clean. No real complaints. We arrived at 1:00pm which is a little early for the 'guaranteed' 4:00 check in. We travel frequently and were surprised that there was not a room available. We witnessed several other couples encounter the same issue. Just be prepared to not have a room until 4pm. Again, not a big problem, but we were surprised. Make sure you have dining reservations before you arriving in Napa if you want to get into some of the better known establishments like Mustards. You can do this easily online. Overall, we would return to this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy, but good value and service”
Reviews.Author: rtdFirenze_Italy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a tour eventually going up to Lake Tahoe. This was a very enjoyable area, solid service, good night's sleep, decent lounge with nice variety of items, small but compact gym with what you need to get a little workout, easy on and off the exit and near to Mustard's Restaurant (a must do in the area)....would recommend it, but do not expect posh or plush. Standard rooms, but large. RTD

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: MariaElena24
Reviews.Content: I just came back from celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday in Napa Valley! We stayed at the Mariott and it was a great place. The food was very good and it was very central from the wineries. Just a ride up 29 or to Silverado Trail. The concierge level was great to have breakfast everyday, and snacks all day if you are around. Missed the wine tastings at the hotel but I am sure they were good. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: HoustonMoose
Reviews.Content: We supposedly upgraded to concierge but honestly it was not nicer than a courtyard actually we stayed in a nicer courtyard on a driving trip before

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, luxury amenities, and a great concierge lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Samantha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights for Napa and Sonoma wine tasting vacation. The hotel is conveniently located with easy access to 29. Close to all major wineries in both Napa and Sonoma. Very close to Yountville where all the awesome restaurants are. Paid $10 extra a night for access to the Concierge Lounge, totally worth the money. Continental breakfast, afternoon snacks, and desserts. Hotel has free wine tasting at 5:00, perfect to pair with food. Free wi fi internet access too. Free sodas and bottled water. Busy on the weekend, but not too bad during the week days. Also used the spa for hot stone and Swedish massage, nothing exceptional, but refreshed. Staff did work very hard to change our time from afternoon to morning so we can rearrange our wine tasting schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaLeite
Reviews.Content: I`m very picky, and concerned about cleanliness. And exceeded my expectations in every detail. The room is very clean, beautifull, tastefull. I wold definitely recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but overpriced...like most of Napa”
Reviews.Author: s s
Reviews.Content: Only concierge rooms were available. Compared to concierge amenities in other hotels, not as good. Not sure it was worth the extra expense, but we had no option. The breakfast buffet in the concierge lounge was very basic, the pastries not fresh from a bakery, so-so fruit salad, the desserts rather blah and boring (same both nights). The wait staff were run off their feet keeping up with the need for clean plates and there was always a shortage of bowls. However, the staff were excellent, never flustered, and were happy to accommodate any need. The availability of coffee/tea was great. The room and bed were comfortable, the garden was lovely, the staff were very helpful, the parking was easy (and free), there was a laundry if needed. Really only chose this because all inns and other hotels were booked except the very expensive or very cheap ones...and decent Napa accommodation is expensive. Good location, about 10 minutes out of downtown Napa - not a problem since there are good restaurants north of Napa. All in all, provided what we needed whilst touring Napa for a couple of days, just think it's overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless, oh, I mean 'inoffensive'”
Reviews.Author: abc1234567890
Reviews.Content: Am I in Napa Valley or the Appalachian Valley? I cannot tell because I am staying at a Marriott. Well executed inoffensiveness typical of (nearly) every Marriott around the world. Sucking the charm and unique characteristics of even the beautiful locations in the world, your inability to tell what time zone you are in has nothing to do with your jet lag. I was here b/c someone else was paying. I would not waste my time or money saying here again on my own dime. Price it higher or price it lower, I want to know that I am in Napa (or even Northern California!) by something other than conference rooms named after grape varietals (e.g., Meritage. oh, I am in wine country!) That said, the place is clean, the facilities ok, the staff is good and the food...well, you had better eat elsewhere given that you are in the best (yes, probably the best) food region in the United States, er, all of North America). Stay here, if every B&B within 50km is booked, but *do not* waste your life experiences eating even one bite here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Marriott”
Reviews.Author: BusyTravellerKildare
Reviews.Content: We have booked in for 2 nights while touring the wineries of Napa, the hotel is excellent, rooms clean, and service superb, the staff do everything to accomodate any request. We want to particularly commend "Shelby" who looked after us in the restaurant,she was the nicest most attentive waitress we have had in a restaurant for many years, as an Elite Marriott member, I have compared hundreds of Hotels around the world, this one is excellent

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Agendaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip to Napa. The check-in went smoothly and we went to our room which was a good size. The bed slept wonderfully and the room was very quiet. We received access to the concierge room that was convenient and well stocked with food and drinks. We ate breakfast there every day. We utilized the fitness center which was well kept. This hotel has a great lobby area with a bar and restaurant. Through the glass doors From the lobby are two outside areas with fire pits. This was really wonderful in the cool of the evening. The location is excellent. It is located right on highway 29 so it is very convenient to get to wine country or downtown Napa. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Sleep”
Reviews.Author: jccatlady
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights at this clean and comfortable hotel! The Beds are truly a Marriott special - comfortable with great linens and pillows - dream sleep! Very Nice - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: wam307
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days at the Napa Valley Marriot ending on 9/15/11. The staff was wonderful. They truly could not have been more helpful, friendly, or welcoming. The service at the hotel restaurant was perfect and the food was just yum. The room was very clean and well appointed. The Marriot was a perfect "home base" for our wanderings through Napa and was a great place to return to after a long day of tastings in great company. It's location is convenient to stores, both large and small...especially a "Whole Foods" very near by. We felt as though the staff could not do enough to make our visit enjoyable. We highly recommend a stay at this spot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Marriott”
Reviews.Author: edandjen
Reviews.Content: If you are platinum, it is even better. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in early September. After spending a few days at another Marriott property near by. Having full service is great. You will definitely want to upgrade to the concierge level. The breakfast, snacks and desert make it worth it. They do have wine tasting nightly, but unlike most other Marriott's concierge, there is no free wine or beer. The hotel has been remodeled recently and it shows. The pool, bar and restaurant area are great. I did not have a chance to check the internet out, but everything else was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: lissie0113
Reviews.Content: This place was great. They had free wine (its Napa afterall) in the lobby everyday. I ate at the hotel bar for breakfast everyday, lunch once, and dinner once, and the food was fantastic. It was probably the best hotel food Ive ever had. The service was attentive. The rooms are your average marriott, nothing special, but they were clean and there was nothing to complain about either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: SuperRestless
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and big. Hotel seemed renovated (carpets had a new look to them). It's also got a decent bar in the lobby, and fruit at checkin! Our rooms came with a "concierge package" which meant that we had access to a lounge (basically a room with sofas and tables, not a fancy lounge) were there were appetizers/fruit during hte day and breakfast in the morning. All in all, a good hotel, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: Bashlee
Reviews.Content: Everything you expect from a Marriott hotel...friendly and helpful staff, clean, nice room, comfortable bed, not a lot to complain about. Would be nice if rooms had a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: PetalumaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott on Friday, August 26. We used Marriott points, so I'm not sure how much the room would have cost. We were in the wing that had just been renovated. The room was clean and everything looked fairly new. We did spend some time at the pool. It is a fairly large pool and there is a waitress who comes out to see if you want anything to eat or drink. I used the fitness center while we were there. There were 3 treadmills, a couple of eliptical trainers, bikes, and hand weights. For the size of the hotel, it could have been bigger. The spa was an extra $20 (I think, maybe $25) if you wanted to go in there. We opted not to, as we were only there for one night. I did hear some grumbles that they should include the spa in the cost of the room. As we were in the "concierge wing", there was a room that had appetizers in the evening (we didn't go to this) and breakfast in the a.m. I did get coffee and juice to bring up to the room. They did have a hot egg dish, so that was nice for people who wanted to grab something quick. I am not sure how to rate this hotel. We have stayed in places up in St. Helena that were so much nicer and had character. This hotel could have been plunked down anywhere. Just nothing special about it. It just served the purpose. If we hadn't used points, I would have looked for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: campbellmi
Reviews.Content: The renovations that have been completed at this hotel are fantastic. The lobby/bar area is stunning and the outdoor patio with fire pits was a perfect place to relax after a long day of winery hopping. Blossom the hotel manager did a great job to ensure any requests we had were met. The central courtyard is a great touch. Big redwood trees, gardens, a swing, all made you feel that you were not at a hotel but more like an inn. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad and average”
Reviews.Author: vinntx
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the location is great. The manager, Blossom, was really helpful. She was able to arrange a roll-away bed (I had called and confirmed). Concierge lounge was good. I thought this was for Platinum members only, but it seemed packed as if everyone was there. Normally, as a Marriott Platinum rewards member, one has access to use of Spa (day spa), for steam room and Sauna and showers etc. This was one of the criteria for me to book the hotel. But here they actually asked me to spend 25 dollars. The guy at the front desk had never heard such a thing. Welcome, to hospitality, in days of tough economic times when hotels struggle to be 70% full, this is the best they could do for me. I might as well have booked a Courtyard or Springhill and saved myself 100 dollars a day or for that matter Hilton Garden Inn, right next door. I have stayed at Marriott Singer Island resort (west palm beach), and Marco island resort. No one ever asked me to pay for Spa use. And these resorts are 100 times better than Napa Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley hotel with a smile”
Reviews.Author: dan m
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the Silverado Trail and downtown at a friendly resort with all the amenities. From the front door valet parking, the genuinely friendly front desk and bellhop, the lobby free wine tasting, the concierge level food, pool, spa and electric bicycle rental (Change of Greenery ), the entire experience was great. The room was large, spotless, and quiet. The restaurant serves excelllent food without pretensions. I'm not sure how you could do better. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Family side trip to Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: ciaobella89
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in SF for a wedding and decided to go to Napa Valley on a whim for one night. We were really surprised that we could book 5 rooms at the Marriott the day before, but were pleasantly surprised by the hotel amenities. First of all, Napa Valley is a beautiful place to visit when you're in California. Secondly, the hotel was a great find at short notice. The pool is a little smaller than expected and to be frank, too plain. There was no lifeguard, but my family and I just spent most of the time tanning by the pool where there were a lot of chairs. The spa was pretty good. Expensive, but what can you expect at a Spa Hotel. The great thing about it is no matter what spa service you pay for, you automatically get a day's access to the spa which includes a steam room, jacuzzi, and a very comfy lounge area. To get access to just the spa with no additional service is already $20-$25, so it's worth the services in my opinion. The gym was small, but pretty good. TVs on all the machines and was kept very clean with individual hand towels to use. The rooms were great. Nothing special about them - typical Marriott style rooms. Lobby was very spacious. There was a Starbucks but very over priced. When you take time to go to Napa Valley, the hotel is not the attraction whatsoever (for obvious reasons!). I went to OpusOne (very pricy, but very good) and Robert Mondavi. Both wineries are owned by the same person btw. Also, Presse Restaurant is AMAZING! Owner of Presse also runs Dean and Deluca. I would recommend it and ask your hotel concierge to help with the booking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: velinas
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that is centrally located! It looked like our room had been recently renovated. The bed was so comfortable! Every afternoon they had wine tasting in lobby which is right off the beautiful pool area. Great street for a morning job. Ask for room close to elevator or use the lobby to get luggage to room and then if you are driving you can park car close to your room.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Heidi1983_10
Reviews.Content: We just spent a relaxing week at this hotel. The room was very clean and the beds couldn't have been more comfortable. The pool area is well kept and in close proximity to all the rooms. At night you can relax on sofas strategically located around fire pits. The staff assisted is in reservations and you are within minutes of vineyards in both directions. The only thing I would like to see changed is the location of the refrigerator. It was inside a cabinet and due to poor venting, it really didn't cool anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rebel82
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great location. The staff overall was very friendly and the pool was great for relaxing. Love the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TLWhite
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day trip to Napa and were quite pleased with the Marriott. The staff was pleasant, check in was easy, and the property was clean and pretty. They offer a one hour wine tasting in the lobby every day which was a nice touch. The rooms were large and nice the bed was oh so comfy!! Parking was free, but a bit difficult to find space on weekend nights. Tried to get massage appointments at spa but were unable. The only thing Marriott could do to keep up with other Napa area hotels is to offer breakfast to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have spent more time here!”
Reviews.Author: lirwin13
Reviews.Content: After staying for several nights in a small hotel room in San Francisco, the Napa Valley Marriott was a welcome treat! I was only here for one night while visiting the wine country, but wish I could have spent several nights here. The room was spacious and comfortable, and all of the staff were very pleasant. There is complimentary wifi in the lobby and also wired computers with internet access in the lobby. The pool area and hot tub looked inviting, though I didn't have enough time to enjoy them. The whole courtyard area was beautiful, with benches and swings and pathways to enjoy. There were also outdoor fire pits burning, which also looked like an inviting place to spend some time. I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit Napa Valley!

Reviews.Title: “We were Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: Sandro0165
Reviews.Content: We Booked the consierge level, for not much more money then a standard room,and we got a Great free breakfeast for our family of 4 , we had free wine tastings from 5 to 7 every night ,The place is great clean and well placed if you will do the winery.s We loved it !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: terrimm
Reviews.Content: Three day business conference in January. Fabulous facility, food, and service for the price - a wonderful, solid value for an outstanding experience. As far as events, I would encourage hotel management to staff up security or "eyes" around private parties. Several of the local bar patrons did crash our before-dinner open bar, and one refused to leave and became verbally abusive after being asked to leave politely. Other than this, a wonderful stay and a terrific value for Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: mjlally
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the time we checked out the service was excellent. The concierges were all awesome while Dominque Catteau was exceptional. She helped to ensure that this special vacation with my bride(of 23 years) was even more special.The location, while relatively close to everything in this compact area, is not in any of the village areas. The grounds are well kept and beautiful. It was nice to sit outside at night and enjoy the gas fireplaces. Room was standard, well maintained. We had a room with a slider to the courtyard and that was a nice extra. My bride had a 4 hour spa session which was nice but not to the standards dictated by the price. We had a salad from the restaurant and it was one of the best meals we had on this two week vacation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a well done hotel experience while staying in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great place R & R”
Reviews.Author: Seattletravel_11
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has beautiful grounds, bicycles for loan/rent? and is a great place to stay. I was there after knee surgery and did not have a chance to get out much, but the hotel staff could not have been nicer. I will go back when I can truly enjoy the pool, spa, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Good Service, Delicious Wine”
Reviews.Author: aljasralucinda
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Marriott Napa Valley Hotel and Spa for a weekend get away in March 2011. Upon our arrival, we were offered an upgraded room and wine sampling. The wine was delicious and the room spacious and well appointed. Our room had access to the hotel gardens, where we enjoyed the evening while sipping wine and snacking on local olives, cheeses and breads/crackers. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would likely stay again. The only downside to this hotel is the location to the Napa Valley bike paths. We wish the location was a little more quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 3 nights. Very nice hotel with a nice outdoor area”
Reviews.Author: mstorey20
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 3 nights. Good spot and would stay again. Location is near stuff but not walking distance to much of anything. Nice clean room. Very nice staff. Great outdoor area around the pool. Free wine hour daily. Good food in the bar/restaurant. Actually spent one night at the hotel at the pool and ate here instead of going out. If I stayed somewhere else it would more in heart of historic napa but otherwise it was great

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SCupertino
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The staff here made us feel extremely welcome. The Concierge Lounge was always stocked with drinks and snacks, and the hotel hosts local wineries to come into do free wine pours from 5-6 every night. Beautiful area around the hotel as well - the pool, fire pits, and hot tub were all nice. I didn't use the spa but the fitness center was good - a nice size for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelAround2011_11
Reviews.Content: While it was inconvenient to have to go outside to get the front desk (as their lobby was not open yet), the staff was very helpful and friendly and did their best considering it was a tough weekend with horrible weather, construction and being sold out. We had a problem with the heater (it was a very cold weekend) and the manager on duty tried to fix it and explained that he did not have another room vacant to move us to. However, he made sure we had enough blankets, the next day made sure a portable heater was placed in our room, and gave us complimentary breakfast for our family. It would have been nice to have our heater working and have access to the lobby, but things happen and at least the management and staff acknowledged the issues and were helpful and friendly throughout a very stressful weekend! The concierge lounge had some great food and was well worth it. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: dalluv
Reviews.Content: First time at this Marriott but have been to several... I especially loved this one just because of the customer service being superb.. from the front desk to the housekeeping & concierge . Grounds was beautiful, our room was immaculate not a single thing to complain. There was a construction but was never a problem. I almost did not notice until they mentioned upon check-in. We are use to timeshare with all the amenities & cool stuff for kids so we were a little worried about picking this hotel after reading a few of the negative reviews. Good thing i followed my instinct because none of the negative reviews I ever encountered. My daughter loved the pool.. I think she was the only one that ever used it the whole time we were there. Was a little chilly but the pool is heated. Concierge lounge was a plus! we were there a lot...We loved the breakfast, appetizers & the desserts. Oh & the unlimited coffee & sodas. So make sure upgrade to concierge level. Place is close to everything. Everyone we encountered were friendly made us felt welcome considering I think we were the only young couple in the hotel with a little girl. They made our stay memorable. Thank you Napa Marriott for that!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it. Great trees. Complaints are more about california than hotel”
Reviews.Author: remorw
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this hotel and thought it was great. Regarding the negative reviews that mention it being only 2 stories, near a busy shopping center and a busy road, this is California we're talking about. The above "complaints" are what you find at most hotels in California. So don't blame the Marriott. The staff, as typical with virtually every Marriott I've stayed at (I'm gold elite level) was friendly and efficient. The pool area was nice. Ate once in the hotel restaurant and the food was quite good. The concierge room had a good variety of food and had more vegetarian options than most Marriott concierge rooms. We just loved the large trees in the courtyard. They provided great ambiance. We had a courtyard view room on the side of the hotel and couldn't hear any noise from the road at all. We almost didn't stay at this hotel because of the negative comments here.. Glad we went ahead and stayed. yes there was some construction going on but it wasn't obtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base for Napa trip”
Reviews.Author: revproj
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate on priceline bidding for a 3 nights stay at the hotel. Location was very good and also very close for a stop on by to the Hendry vineyard. It's not exactly ideal if you want to stay in Downtown Napa as that's still a 2 mile drive but it's right near highway 29 for an easy path up through Napa Valley. The staff was extraordinarily friendly from check in to the maids. Everyone was willing to do their part and help throughout the experience. Some of the best things were the room layout and the bed. The standard rooms also have a shared balcony. The gym is excellent although a bit of a walk from other parts of the hotel and provides treadmills, ellipticals, bicycles, free and machine weights. Some of the drawbacks was the lack of water pressure and hot water in the shower and the walls being so thin to the point you can full on hear the conversation next door. Would recommend bringing earplugs. The construction was not noisy but I did notice some loose nails around the parking lot so just be cautious when driving around. I would stay here again considering the value of service the staff puts in and the cheaper cost of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “staff was excellant and made up for the hotel being under construction”
Reviews.Author: Linda60769
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on the hotel, I wasn't quite sure what to expect. Check in was extremely quick and I was given access to the conceige lounge. My room was located on the back of the hotel so there was no road noise. A friend of mine was delayed in getting to Napa and the concierge was kind enough to leave a message at the French Laundry for me cancelling her dinner for the next night. Traveling alone (unexpectedly) the lounge was a nice place to visit with other guests. At breakfast the conceirge suggested a plan for my day complete w/ maps etc. There was a nice evening happy hour with wine when I returned. A morning of rain turned into a spa day at the hotel. I had read a review about Mercer who worked at the spa. Luckily, when I called that morning Mercer was available and he was wonderful. I changed my massage from 50 to 80 minutes. I wasn't aware that the spa had specials but it was too late to take advantage of these so check them out when you check in. I was the only person at the spa so took advantage of all the ammenities. There is also a day use fee available to hotel guests. Staff great even when they got very busy with the Napa Marathon (they were the check in place for the race). Room was comfy except I could work the thermostat.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: kennnylev1
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel in lower Napa Valley.....A step up from a Holiday Inn but definitely not 4-star luxury. No views or ambience....but rooms are new and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “No bad review here....”
Reviews.Author: musicbox71
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't know what the previous two people are complaining about, I am staying here right now. Check-in was a breeze, and we were very early. There were signs clearly directing you to where you check in while the hotel is under construction. The front desk was extremely accomodating in letting us check in early (about 1:00 p.m.) and I was grateful for that so we could unload and go start our exploring. The room is incredibly clean (and I am a total germaphobe so coming from me is quite a compliment) and I felt very comfortable. Pillows and mattress are very comfy and even though we are on the freeway side, it is very quiet at night. I slept just as well as I would at home. So don't believe everything you read. Yes, there are a few inconveniences with the construction but when you get into the room, it's very easy to overlook all that. I also have to say the hot tub is really warm and felt very relaxing last night. I give this hotel two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bdevineDC
Reviews.Content: Always stay in a Marriott when we travel if we can. Can not tell you how disappointed we were with our experience here. The construction created a place with no central location and we had to enter through side doors. Trying to find the conceierge was ridiculous.
