I ended up, in the rain, walking the perimeter of the hotel due to bad directions from the staff. Not once but 3 times. Rooms were fine but the service was lacking significantly. What a dissapointment. Ps. When making the reservation they never once mentioned the construction and the problems it would cause

Reviews.Title: “Marriott never disappoints ....”
Reviews.Author: Poohh66
Reviews.Content: Despite the remodeling of the lobby, check-in went smoothly. I must say that as a Gold Reward Member this is the first time that we were told that the room was not ready and that they would call us when it was, we arrived and hour and a half early to checkin) when we came back about 45 min. later to ask to get a concierge lounge key where we could sit comfortably until our room was ready, we were told the room was indeed ready then, and everything else went well. The room was spacious, bed very comfortable, the bathroom spacious, and very clean. The concierge lounger was a plus, you can find cold soda and water all day, the breakfast was good, scrambled eggs, pastries and bagel and toast, cereal, yogurt and some fruits.... perfect to start our day. Came to the afternoon appetizer hour a couple of times and it was wonderful including the wine and beer, as well as the brownies during dessert time ! Overall a very nice experience, location was convenient too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: auntieadriene
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Marriott Napa on NYE 2010. At that time, the receiption was under renovation (we were informed prior on the booking website which was good). However, there was minimal inconvenience as it was very clearly marked with bright signs that the reception was at the adjourning spa building instead. Check in was very fuss free and efficient by 2 very pleasant and friendly staff members even though the actual check in area was quite small and there were about 4 parties waiting to check in. I think that itself was managed very well. We had just got off the plane from an 18 hour flight and 2 hour drive from SFO , so that was very welcome indeed! The room itself was very clean and with modern decoration, warm lighting which we liked. Everything you can expect from Marriott hotels in the USA. We liked that it was very quiet (I suppose Napa in general is a quiet town) but the hotel itself was spread out (2 levels) and we had a nice room facing the pool. Parking was free and ample and we could park right up to the entrance near our room which was good with lots of luggage! Location was good near to the local Target and mall area. So groceries and shopping was good. It was also near to the town centre where we had our NYE dinner. Service was great. They gave us recommendations for a great restaurant for our NYE dinner in town. They also connected us (several times as there was no answer) to our tour operator for the hot air balloon flight the next morning - which was sadly cancelled due to bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base for trips through the napa valley.”
Reviews.Author: KRock_06
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well presented property at a reasonable price. Provides an excellent base for trips further into the valley and promotes and supports the region well.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel you can count on!"”
Reviews.Author: destinationchange
Reviews.Content: We previously stayed at the Marriott in 2007 and enjoyed our stay then. For our trip this time we decided to stay farther up in Calistoga. After one night of a HORRIBLE hotel in Calistoga we were desperate to quickly find a more comfortable and still close by option. We knew we could count on the Marriott to accommodate us for the rest of our stay! We called over and were able to get a reservation and checked in less than an hour later. They had a 200+ person business conference checking in at the same time and there were no issues. They were prompt, friendly and even upgraded up to their Concierge Lounge for being Marriott members. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and easily accessible to the parking. The concierge lounge offers a great variety of foods throughout the day. Thankfully, we can always count on Marriott Napa Valley...and we won't be trying new hotels in the area again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 32480Robert
Reviews.Content: Great location to the Napa Wine Area. Pretty standard for the Marriott....the work out room was great and the Concierge Wing is a must. The property was in the process of a re-design and it would have been nice knowing that when we called....but all in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aero247
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent two nights in the hotel and really enjoyed ourselves. I booked the room through Amex Travel and it included a complimentary upgrade to the concierge wing and a bottle of wine. When I checked-in, the front desk failed to mention that they didn't have anything in the concierge wing available until after she handed me my keys but something would be available later on in the day. I told her I was just interested in the access to the concierge lounge (free food/drinks) and she gave me access to the lounge after looking at my reservation again. Note to all: print out your reservation confirmations if it includes any sort of deal/package. The concierges that we dealt with were extremely helpful. They gave us directions and a few recommendations on places to wine taste and go for dinner. They really helped make the trip. Make sure you stay in a room with access to the concierge lounge. The breakfast and app. spread was very nice and access to the sodas and water all day long was great. The room was recently remodeled (apparently it was newer than the concierge level) and was very spacious. It opened up onto a patio that looked out at the pool. If you are looking to eat at the restaurant on-site, make sure you go to restaurant.com before hand. They have certificates for the restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: TogoGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Marriott from a deal offered on Travelzoo. We originally wanted to stay at a more remote, unique type of place, but we couldn't beat the deal...room was $109/night, plus 4 free wine tasting coupons at good wineries, plus discounted spa services. The room was really great...large, super comfortable king-size bed, nice shower, really nice bedding. Our only complaint was that there wasn't a mini-fridge. The location isn't great in terms of being in a cute place and we couldn't walk to downtown Napa or restaurants. The hotel is located off the main highway in Napa (traffic noise wasn't a problem at all), which is convenient to get to wineries but doesn't add much in the way of ambiance. That being sad, we were very close to several grocery stores (including Whole Foods) and coffee shops. What more? Concierge was helpful and my massage was well above average. Be sure to request Mercer as your masseuse.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: CFire2000
Reviews.Content: Good location, beautiful rooms and friendly staff. Close and convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Most Accommodating..and lovely clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: TeddiBiltmore
Reviews.Content: We live in Napa and are going through a house renovation. We booked here for two nights before taking a holiday while house is being worked on. The staff couldn't be nicer. Lovely evening wine and appetizers. We had room service and the food was very good and NOT expensive (as far as Napa goes). Good Food...Very nice staff...lovely rooms. They appreciate your business..how great is that? This hotel is undergoing it's own renovation and they are doing their best to make your stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except for the noise”
Reviews.Author: Indygirl222
Reviews.Content: I visited for a Saturday night and though the room was clean and nicely decorated the noise level in the hotel is out of control. if someone is in the hall and talks it is like they are in your room. We unfortunately had a very loud group of people on our floor. My brother and sister-in-law were on the bottom floor near check in and they had the same complaint. You would think that the people running check in would have told the people to quiet down but they didn't. I called the hotel the Monday after my stay and was passed to the managers voicemail and left him a message and he never called me back.....so I guess I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it to spring for the Concierge Level”
Reviews.Author: Pumula
Reviews.Content: I had a really nice big room. I only paid $10/night more to be on the "Conceirge level". My co-worker was in a regular room and said it was so small he couldn't even walk around the bed. The Conceirge card get's you free breakfast...lots of fruit, pastry, coffee, teas, oatmeal, toast and some egg dishes. Also free water and cokes all day long. Appetizers and wine in the evening and dessert at night. The room had someone working in it to keep everything clean and stocked all day. I was impressed. Every staff member I encountered was very polite and friendly. I opted for a room with two double beds instead of a King because I was in a hurry to check in. While the room was very large, especially the bathroom, the two beds were so tiny, I"m not sure they were even doubles. I'm pretty sure I slept so bad because I kept rolling out of bed...ha ha. The conference room was nice and the staff kept the refreshments stocked. you MUST eat at "Characters" , the BBQ restaurant in the hotel....i ate there everyday it was soooooooooooooooo good There is a Target, World Market, Trader Joes, Starbucks, Whole Foods, and a book store, within walking distance. My only complaint was the noise from the hallway...the doors slam SO loud, but I stuffed a towel under the door and was not bothered anymore. The room had a mini fridge, but it didn't get very cold. (OK, i guess I had two complaints) (three) I wish they had miccrowaves in the rooms I'm not usually a Marriott stayer, but I would stay here again, Conceirge level of course free parking in room wireless internet was something like $4.95 a day

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: DougGroveCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over Thanksgiving. It has a good location right on route 29. Check in was fast and the front desk staff and concierge were very helpful. Apparently an old Holiday Inn that has been refurbished. Rooms are very comfortable with nice amenities. Only complaint was the room furnace/air conditioner was very loud when running. It is not a window unit but on the outside wall, everytime it started you had to turn up the TV to here it. Room and bath were very clean and they were very prompt making up the rooms in the morning. Last year we stayed at the Renaissance in Sonoma and would choose that one for our next stay even though this Marriott was good.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful getaway and more!!”
Reviews.Author: cmccabenc1
Reviews.Content: We loved our evening here!! Rooms are clean, service was great, and I happened to obtain a great deal via Trip Advisor website, so we were fine with the value! I would definitely stay here again at the special price. Spa was very nice too...very relaxing, and both Dyan and my eyebrow person did a GREAT JOB! I recently moved to SF and am definitely considering having them do my nails and eyebrows on a regular basis while enjoying wine and food in Napa!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but unaddressed details leave spa lacking”
Reviews.Author: AnneinVT
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, service was great. Visited the spa before departure and purchased lots of products and asked for them to be shipped...needed them for a gift but they must have sat around for awhile and didn't arrive on time. Spa wouldn't reimburse me for the shipping or offer any type of alternative. Said I could ship them back for credit...at my cost! ...and how about a free raccoon with that deal??? Would be great if the Spa shared the same attention to detail as the hotel staff. They went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating(my luggage was delayed, they offered free amenities and a bottle of wine to help get by!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: junga11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a short trip to Napa, so we only stayed here one night but were very pleased with the hotel. The amenites were great, the staff was very friendly, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Next time we are in Napa we definitely plan on staying here again so we can take advantage of the spa services and workout facility!

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to visiting again!!”
Reviews.Author: wdw1999
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott and both times were very enjoyable!! Rooms are much larger that normal, with separate seating area and pull out desk. Large flat screen tv, in room safe, coffee/tea maker, and large refrigerator... perfect for enjoying wine and cheese/fruit from visits to Napa and surrounding areas. Location is right off main highway, but set back into slightly wooded area. Very close to Trader Joes, Wendys, and lots of restaurants/grocery stores. Altho 24 hr fitness center is in a separate building, it's worth the short walk for chilled hand/face towels!!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, OK location”
Reviews.Author: 02Hoosier
Reviews.Content: We used points to stay at the Marriott in Napa. Overall, the hotel was a bit outdated but the rooms were a reliable Marriott room with space and updated amenities. The hotel's layout is a bit confusing since it's spread out as opposed to a mid or hi-rise. We had a difficult time finding our room initially and ended up having to walk through the concourse area by the ballrooms (where meetings were being held) in order to stay inside and out of the rain. The room itself doesn't disappoint, but the hotel itself was just OK. Friendly staff, which is always a must. Also, there was a lot going on in the lobby area which was fun when we were going out to dinner or coming back from the wine tour. Lots of people around which kept things lively but didn't disrupt our sleep. It was our first time in Napa Valley and we regretted not being a bit further up Hwy 29. This wasn't a bad hotel, but for the price ($370+) I would recommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel doesn't justify the price but you are in Napa”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: Just to set the record straight, I didn't pay anything for my three day stay here Used points). I'm a Platinum Elite member with Marriott and stay over 100 nights per year at Marriott hotels throughout the US and internationally. However, I did check the rates on Marriott's website and they were running $300 and up depending on the package for the dates we stayed there. The hotel itself is a low rise (only two floors) and because of this, is spread out over a large area. Depending on where your room is located, it can be a long walk from the lobby to your room. There is not adequate parking when the hotel is full and especially when there is an event going on. The parking lot looks like a mall the day before Christmas and it will take you almost that long to find a parking spot (if you find one at all). The rooms look to be recently remodeled with new beds, flat screen TV''s and remodeled bathrooms although the bathrooms are reminiscent of a hotel built 30 + years ago which means they are small, only one sink and have a tub/shower combination. The fact that the concierge lounge is open seven days a week is a plus. Typically most Marriott lounges close mid-day Friday and re-open late Sunday. It's obvious that Marriott must sell this feature to non-Elite guests because the lounge is packed on the weekends and practically empty on the weekdays. Breakfast is typical Marriott lounge fare with eggs, breads/pastries, fruit, etc. Evening cocktails consist of free wine, soda water, juice although no honor bar (which is also unusual for Marriott lounge). Asst. crackers and cheese and a hot appetizer. Dessert is always cookies and brownies. I don't know if I'd pay a premium for this but Elite members get free access to the lounge so it was nice that the lounge was open over the weekend. Didn't eat in either of the restaurants so I couldn't comment on the quality of food but I was told by a small winery owner that the Marriott chef was a notable BBQ chef. I did notice on the menu that there was a larger than normal selection of BBQ items available. The Marriott bills itself as the Napa Marriott Hotel and Spa. The spa (as well as the work out room) is in a separate building next to the hotel. Don't pay to use the spa unless you're getting a treatment. If you're a Platinum Elite member (or a guest of one), the access fee is waived. I went in to use the facilities which consisted of a small whirlpool and steam room. There is no sauna. While clean, the "spa" facilities reminded me more of a high school gym then a nice spa. There is a co-ed relaxation room located outside of the mens/womans spa areas that were nice, but lacked the typical spa amenities (bottled water, juices, fruit, snacks, etc.). If you've ever been to a nice spa in Vegas and expect to have the same experience here, think again. The Marriott is in a central location with easy access to downtown Napa, Sonoma and of course the Napa wine country. This is probably the hotels best attribute. But if I actually had to pay to stay here I think I'd pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyGalway
Reviews.Content: This was a really lovely hotel - rooms very spacious, the most comfortable beds & very quiet. The concierge desk were great for advice on local amenities. This is a great location for touring Napa, with lovely restaurants nearby if you choose to eat outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: ACEinSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights in October. The rooms are big and clean. The concierge service access is worth the extra $$ since you have a WONDERFUL breakfast and appetizers with wine at night. We also got to enjoy our own wine in the concierge lounge while the kids had a place to color and play video games (our own) in a larger space. Pool and hot tub were clean. Workout room was clean and well equipped. The front desk was helpful and the location is convenient for Napa and Sonoma wineries. This is a kid-friendly place in the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: Aaron-Michael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Resort & Spa for a week in October of 2010 for vacation and it was exquisite. From the time we walked in the doors until the minute we left it was a simply a perfect vacation resort. The staff were extremely courteous, knowledgeable and friendly. The resort sits on this beautiful lot full of trees and greenery. We felt like we were truly indulging in wine country our entire stay. The room was pretty spacious, we upgraded and had plenty of room for the two us. The resort was very relaxing and quite, although there were tons of things going on each day we never felt rushed or like we were in some busy conference hotel. Each morning we would go down to the concierge lounge for breakfast, where they had an assortment of great breakfast items. The lounge opened up to this amazing beautiful patio that was built to resemble a Napa Winery. There was a wedding happening that weekend and we were able to watch from the lounge and it was truly remarkable. The lounge was open all weekend which is rare but well planned. There was wine tasting each evening and lots of cheese and crackers, so you truly didn't have to leave the resort. The Concierge staff was AMAZING! They were so knowledgeable and helpful with everything we wanted to do. They recommended the best wine tour I've ever been on (Platypus Wine Tours) and they got us reservations at the most happening restaurants in town. They also directed us to great shopping and to their world class spa. We spent an entire day at the spa indulging and relaxing in the ambiance that the spa created. We were treated like Royalty from the moment we step foot in the facility which is attached to the resort. We had the Adam & Eve couples massage, facial, manicures, the works...and then I took a super long steam bath which just capped off such a wonderful day. There is no way you couldn't relax at this place, and we loved every minute of it. If you are looking for a relaxing vacation resort that has every amenity imaginable, plus is centrally located to downtown Napa and all of the wineries...this is your one-stop-shop. The night manager and I had wonderful chats about Napa and I learned so much about it's vast history and upbringing. This was such a romantic place to be in and we can't wait to recapture our moments at Napa again! For restaurants that you must visit here are my top 4: 1. Bottega (Michael Chiarello's restaurant-He is one of the stars on the Food Network) 2. Celadon (Owned my Napa local Greg Cole) 3. Cole's (Also owned by Greg Cole) 4. Rutherford Grill You can't go wrong in Napa folks, take my word for it!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge level worth the extra $'S”
Reviews.Author: BobandCec
Reviews.Content: Wife bought the romance package which included the concierge lounge access, wine and strawberries. The lounge access was worth it on it's own. Strawberries were very good. The wine though was very substandard when you consider this is in the midst of wine country. A red blend with no body, blend or sophistication. Bed was very comfortable and our room was quiet. There also was a wine tasting event in the lobby which was a nice greeting upon our check-in. Only real complaint is this is yet another hotel nickel and diming you over internet access - my base expectation is free any more when you consider how many economy hotels throw it in as a free amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Great base camp for our Napa adventure and family wedding”
Reviews.Author: ChrisInLA54
Reviews.Content: When traveling to Napa for a family wedding, we chose this Marriott for its moderate price compared to so many of our other options. It allowed us to splurge on great meals out including Ristorante Don Giovanni, our favorite casual stop, Mustards, and to enjoy the wedding at Auberge du Soleil, a beautiful twenty minute drive away through rolling vineyards. The gym was well equipped. Wine glasses in the room was a nice touch and homage to testing out purchases at wineries toured during the day!

Reviews.Title: “Valentines Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mcapps143
Reviews.Content: I booked Valentines weekend in Napa and stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott Hotel & Spa and it was fabulous!! They had nightly reception with different wineries sampling their wines. They also had 2 restaurants which were nice. Awesome room with patio door leading out into courtyard and pool. Staff was really nice and helpful. Awesome hotel!! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The staff made it!”
Reviews.Author: TrishnFamily
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay was amazing!!! The bed was SO comfortable and the room was VERY clean! We loved the wine in the evenings and the breakfast in the morning! We will DEFINATELY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Xplore_More
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for several days. The Marriott is a little old, but very well maintained. The rooms were big enough to be comfortable and very comfortable beds. We stayed on the concierge level which included a continental breakfast, happy hour, and desserts. The quality and quantity of food and wine were acceptable. The hotel is conviently located close to the main hub of Napa and a short drive to most wineries. The staff definitely made this an excellent stay. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge were more than helpful with anything from tee times, reservations, and local information. We could not have asked for better service. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BPK_Travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here for our anniversary and a friends wedding and the only thing about our trip that disappointed us was the Marriott. My wife is a Gold Elite Member and upon check in they said that we would get an upgraded room. The room was standard and smelled like vinegar and mildew. So much for building up our expectations. They quickly relocated us to a new room that was fine, typical Marriott rooms with comfortable beds. There are lots of hallways and exterior doors that require key access, which is nice for security, but inconvenient if you're carrying a case of wine or luggage. The card reader near our room was also tempermental and only worked about 25% of the time. Bring ear plugs, many of the doors slam shut and echo down the hallways. Service was a mixed bag, most of the staff was extremely outgoing and helpful while others didn't seem to care. Overall, I would not recommend the Marriott. There are plenty of nicer hotels/b&bs in Yountville and St. Helena that are more centrally located to the wineries. If I had to stay in Napa, I would highly recommend the Westin over the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Angie626
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 3 nights while visiting the Napa wineries. Check in was quick and easy and we really liked our room. We were on the second floor facing the parking lot, but I heard absolutely no noise from the lot or the street. The beds were very comfortable! We enjoyed breakfast in the lobby restaurant every morning, one morning ordering from the menu (the cornmeal blueberry pancakes - yum!), and then doing the weekend buffet on the others. They made great omelets and the food was fresh and plentiful. There was also complimentary Starbucks coffee in the lobby. We also enjoyed the happy hour in the evenings and often took our glass of wine to the swing out back to recap our day. The concierge was terrific. Sam and Shari both made excellent recommendations as far as wineries to visit, restaurants, and loaded us up with winery coupons and a highlighted map each day. They really made our trip wonderful. My only tiny complaint was the lack of internet access and printers. I understand they want to push their concierge level rooms, but I would have liked free wi fi in the rooms, or at least the lobby for more than an hour. Yes, you only get free wi fi in the lobby for one hour during your entire trip. We went to the business office to print some shipping labels and the cost per minute on the pc, plus the cost per page seemed a little steep. Other than that, the stay was great and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bill99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nites in September and had an excellent stay. We booked through Priceline at $90 per nite which was a great deal given the quality of the hotel. It is not a big hotel just two stories with meticulous grounds. It is located just off Highway 29 so it was easy on and off to the vineyards. Our room was on the first floor and very quiet. Parking is free. WI-FI is free in the lobby. The room was good size, very clean and had a good size bath and shower. It had gone through a major renovation a few months before. Carpeting was new throughout the common areas and the lobby was good size with plenty of seating. Concierge desk, Jan and Sam, were very helpful in guiding you to the areas vineyards. Several of the local wine tours picked up guests from here. Concierge will provide several discount coupons to the vineyards. Each nite the hotel offers a complimentary wine tasting from the local winerys. We used the pool which was very clean and pool area very well maintained. It is a quick walk over to Target, Whole Foods and Trader Joes at the near by shopping plaza. We had a nice meal at Bounty Hunter in the downtown district, about a 10 minute drive. We would definitely stay here again: highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Sherry021
Reviews.Content: I spent the Labor Day weekend at the Marriott Spa in Napa with 3 friends for a girl's weekend. It was my first time in Napa and I can't say enough about the Marriott hospitality. I stay at Marriott hotels for business trips and I'm always satisfied with their service. If you take the concierge area, they offer breakfast, appetizers and a 2 hour happy hour every night. It's well worth it. We started with a spa treatment, which was wonderful and headed off the wineries. Here are some great large and small wineries to see: Jarvis, Hess Trinchero, Hagafen Cellars, Mario Andretti's and Sequoia Hills. These were our favorites because of the warm staff, good wine and they were not to busy. Our final winery, Sequoia Hills, was one of our ultimate favorites because of their great wine and Nicholas. He was the nice and so friendly we bought a case of wine. For lunch or dinner you must try Angele' and Don Giovanni Bistro in Napa, Farmstead in St. Helena (fresh, homegrown foods) Uva Trattoria. What a great trip and I can't wait to go back and YES I would stay at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: zengirl16
Reviews.Content: Normally, I like to stay in a B&B in the Napa area, but we tried the Marriott. If you take the concierge area, they offer a lot of extras, and well worth it- like breakfast, appetizers, ,and desserts at certain hours.When we were there, their appetizers were grilled heirloom tomatoes and feta. Amazingly yummy. I have never seen such great service. If we called about something, someone was there in a few minutes. There was a great mall across from it- Target, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, and Pharmaca- all together. Never seen that before. Only thing was we were charged for Internet which we didn't use but they took care of it at check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on North side of Napa”
Reviews.Author: Robi0304
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel on the north side of Napa. Apparently if you visit in mid-to-late August you get to share your hotel with the Oakland Raiders (as they have training camp there). The grounds were nice, the hot tub was nice (although extremely chlorinated) and it was only a short walk away from TJ's, whole foods, and Target - which is great if you prefer preparing your own meals while on travel (I often do this for my breakfast) The hotel also works with a bike rental service (not Marriot affiliated) called Change of Greenery. They rent electric bikes which is a fantastic way to see wine country & parts of downtown Napa! As far as the sleep quality - I could not necessarily hear traffic on I-29, but could sometimes hear noise from the hallway. When I head back to Napa, I may consider trying to get a hotel closer to downtown, but this hotel for all it offered was still quite nice & enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding helpers”
Reviews.Author: BruceByron
Reviews.Content: I would like to compliment the entire staff at the Napa Marriott Resort. This was headquarters for our daughter's wedding party. We could not have done better at twice the price. Every request (no matter how odd) was greeted with a "can do" attitude and a smile. From the desk clerks to the restaurant waitresses to the cleaning staff, everyone was pleasant, accommodating and helpful. As stressful and hectic as weddings can get, it was great to stay at a place that reduced the pressure and facilitated the process. Everyone who stayed with us was thrilled and I, needless to say, was delighted. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Asatis
Reviews.Content: Right in the city of Napa. Within minutes of many vineyards . The check in was quick and the room was very clean. The bed was comfortable as usual for Mariott’s standard. Oh, and the bathroom, spacious! Can’t think of anything to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfy, convenient location - we had a great week here”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this place in summer 2010 for six nights. We came here to have some nice, romantic time ... and of course to try lots of wines. The Hotel is located close to Hwy 29, so it's easy to find and convenient to travel to the vineyards. The Highway is still far away enough, so you sure won't be disturbed by noise. The Hotel and its area is quite big. The Hotel has a ground and first floor. Just tell them what you prefer when you check-in. The check-in was fast and friendly. The whole Hotel is very well maintained and spotless clean...no funny smell at all. And feels safe all the time, even you come back at night. The rooms are quite spacious. There's some office space, extra table and a comfy TV chair. The bed itself was one of the most comfortable ones we had on our many trips. The only thing we missed here was a microwave. There was a fridge though (some complained on this website here that there isn't a fridge. Well, there IS...it inside the cupboard where the TV is....so it's halfway hidden, looks just like drawers) Like the whole Hotel, the room and bathroom both were very clean. The Hotel has two restaurants. We didn't go to any of them. The were mostly pretty empty. And there's lots of good options around anyway. The pool area was pretty nice, but was hard to get some seats...but nice. If you need any help, there's also a helpful concierge in the lobby area. If you feel like some sports, there's the free fitness Centre. People here (guests and staff) were always in a good mood and friendly. A nice, quiet Hotel to have some good time in Napa. And like I said, it's close to the vineyards. Just by Hwy 29 (which brings you up and down Napa Valley to most vineyards). We had a really good time and would definetly come back here. Wanna know more about my trips? route66traveler.jimdo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in spite of the looks”
Reviews.Author: Reason88
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a great hotel, located near downtown Napa and the Wine Train. On the inside it's a beautiful sight wand offers big rooms and a nice concierge. All that said, on the outside it isn't very appealing (sort of looks like the Pentagon) and has an odd number of disconnected buildings, with only two floors. The Oakland Raiders were holding their training camp here when we were there, that was crazy, kind of interesting to have rooms in the same place as some of the best athletes in the world. Wife took part in the Spa, really liked it. Overall very nice hotel, highly recommended, we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: 5125chi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights, our rate was $203. per night. On arrival they upgraded us to a garden room on the Conceirge Level, the room was comfy! The room key accessed a well stocked room below ours stocked with daily continental breakfast of oatmeal, cereal, fruits, scrambled eggs & asst. bakery wow! Later there is wine & appetizers of veggies, won tons, bread & cheeses. Little pastries & coffee in late evening, wow can't say how great that all was! We'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place in WIne Country”
Reviews.Author: FinFanAtl
Reviews.Content: Everything was as expected for a $238/night Marriott stay. Friendly staff, clean rooms, comfy beds and typical buffet breakfast. Very convenient to Napa, Sonoma, and wine country. The Oakland Raiders were staying there during our visit but the only indication of it was the walled off guarded parking in the back of the hotel (have to protect the $200,000 cars). Don't be shocked when you see the junk-fee tourism taxes tacked on your bill - hopefully some of it will be used to plug the pot holes in downtown Napa. For a slightly less costly option there is a Hilton Garden Inn right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - beautiful hotel with excellent facilities and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: MacAroniSenior
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel on 12th July with my wife and two daughters (20 and 16). Unfortunately, for us, only booked one night as we were touring California, Nevada and Arizona. Fabulous hotel. Bedrooms great - two very comfortable queen sized beds in each bedroom. Rooms and bathrooms spotless. Great facilities including lovely swimming pool. Had St Louis ribs for lunch in bar upon arrival - best ribs I ever tasted! Staff very friendly and helpful. Will be returning for 25th wedding anniversary in 2014. Absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, but Napa wine took the edge off my Marriott whining”
Reviews.Author: Faxgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice because the location is good. The last trip was for business. This time, my husband took a trip with my parents. My parents picked the hotel. Unfortunately, when we checked in (with our confirmation number), the front desk lady told me they were sold out of King rooms. This is irritating and unacceptable! We had a confirmed reservation. As newlyweds, we weren't very happy paying the same rate to stay in a room with 2 full beds. We ended up sleeping in separate beds - too crowded for 2 adults accustomed to a Queen or King size bed. To make matters worse, that double bed room was on the ground floor near the loading area - we were awakened in the night by what sounded like a fleet of delivery trucks. The garbage truck then acted as our alarm clock first thing in the morning. Obviously we complained. I wanted a refund, but lost that battle. The manager apologized and relocated us to 2nd floor King. The outside fountain helped drown out background noise which was a huge relief. The manager sent us a hand written note, bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. A nice gesture, but no excuse for not having our King room available the first night. It was cheap champagne (not even from California). If my parents had not been staying there too, we would have packed up and gone elsewhere. I decided not to spoil everyone's trip. Relocating hotels would have been a huge hassle for my parents. We also paid for Club Level access. That was a disappointment. The room was overly crowded and the entrance was not secured. It was clear that just about anyone could walk in regardless of whether they paid extra for the Club Level. At one point, I walked by the club room and the door was wide open. They may as well take the key card access joke off the door and hang a sign that says, "Come on in off the street and help yourself." The complimentary dessert was nothing special -- the same cookies every night. After watching a young boy spritz the cookies with a sneeze, then baste them with his germy hand, we decided not to eat anything else at the Club Level. No club cookies for me, thanks. I definitely feel this property is over priced. I frequent Marriott properties and this hotel is closer to the quality expected at a Courtyard. I like Courtyard's just fine -- they are clean and basic. This property may have been a thread count higher than the quality of a Courtyard. That's about it. It's certainly not as nice as other Marriott "Resort" properties. As the week went on, my bitterness mellowed. Napa Valley wine helped take the edge off my Marriott whining. I figured I'd save it for Trip Advisor. Hopefully someone at Marriott will read this and make some changes. We didn't spend much time at the hotel anyway. Our time and focus was on touring the wineries. Napa Valley is such a treat! It would have been nice to stay at a nicer property, but that's what future trips are for. I will look elsewhere in the future. I'm rating this hotel Average. Everything in Napa is pricey, so I'm not sure we could have found a better rate during the week we went. I did notice a new Courtyard down the road. Wish we had known about that location. Since this hotel was sold out, perhaps there is opportunity for more competition. I'd like to see a nice Hampton Inn on the Napa Valley scene. Also, the downtown area is still under construction. It sure would be nice to stay downtown next time -- lot's of room for economic boom in Napa. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jasoncrh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I took advantage of a Travelzoo special - $99 a night, wine tasting, free coupons for the vineyards, and a bottle of wine. we were both very impressed by the hotel. All staff, especially the concierge, were friendly, with some great restaurant recommendations. Food at the hotel for breakfast was standard (we had the buffet) but well done and excellent. Waitress friendly and genuine. Our room was comfortable - it opened up to the garden and pool. Bed excellent, bathroom nice, perfect. Great location right off highway 29 - easy access to all the great stuff in Napa. In short - a great comfortable convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SkylarRoseville
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 5th year annaversary in Napa. It was so easy getting around Napa and being based out of the Marriott was perfect. I loved this location in relation to the winery's. The pool and hot tub were perfect each night.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Bed and comfort- but otherwise not Marriott”
Reviews.Author: CrankyOldGuy
Reviews.Content: First trip to Napa and relied on Marriot experience from the past. This is a Marriott bed and comfort, but not what I would expect of Marriott otherwise. Clean, but an older location with multiple wings and outside entrances. For the money, I would have expected a TV remote with batteries, and a sink that was not stopped up. Acceptable, Clean, Spacious, but not what I have come to expect from Marriott and their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: krlylox
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent midweek at this property. I booked the gardenview because many Tripadvisors were unhappy with the Concierge level. The Hotel is 2 floors with several wings. The complaint of construction is outside on the street and only the rooms facing that area would be effected. Check with hotel before booking room in order to determine if your room would be facing the street. The gardenview room faced the pool and veranda area. We never heard noise on the second floor. The room is totally renovated. The furniture, carpet, bedding etc was clean. We thought the mini fridge was helpful in keeping fruit and water. The Fiji water is $4.50 and we purchased the Safeway brand which was cheap. The hotel staff are available, friendly and knowledgeable. Although we learn that some were unaware of one area or another. The Wine Train which travels Napa to St. Helena was enjoyable. My husband is a train person and we booked the Vista Dome car which serves a gourmet lunch. Sparking wine is included; however the wine with the different courses is offered at a nomial cost. The person who booked our tour told us to be at the station at 10:20 am. The Train started boarding at 11 am. Prior to boarding there was a wine tasting experience. The breakfast in the morning was fabulous. We ate every morning in the restaurant and were served by the sweetest gracious waitresses. We ate off the menu and not the buffet. We had 4 breakfast meals and not once did we repeat what we had eaten the day before. Perhaps, the complaint about the boring breakfast is buffet related; however the food was hot, flavorful and the portion size was generous. The coffee is rich and dark with no bitter taste. We drink our coffee black; therefore we really enjoyed this cup in the morning. Lunch was available in Characters which is the sports bar. Not a huge menu; therefore for a picky eater it could be a slight problem. Order the ice tea and put in a simple syrup with mint which is on every table. That is good! We relaxed in the lobby a few times. It was busy but not as noisy as we expected. I booked a spa package the last day. The technicians are soft spoken, warm and friendly. The treatment rooms and relaxing room are not soothing and people friendly. The relaxing room had apples and water which was not comfort food for a spa. Also, The relaxing room and lockers were tiny. The overall package is good but this is not a spa resort hotel. This is not a bad place; it is just another day spa that is convenient to the hotel. I booked with Marriott and recieved a terrific room and a fair price. I agree with other Tripadvisors that booking with the hotelchain can be a better experience than using a discounter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location, very comfortable, definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: ldf59
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal at this hotel through travelzoo. Package included wine, 3 tastings, evening wine reception, and upgrade to concierge level. Not in downtown but right off highway. Great location to end full day in Napa. Breakfast, beverages, and happy hour all were good. Spa next door but didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 20-something-vaca
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, just what you would expect from a Marriott. Clean rooms and hallways. Super comfy beds. Good, prompt room service. Helpful front desk. Free parking. This was just what we needed for a quick weekend in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not the service I would expect from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: footguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice with nice rooms. I didn't like the layout at all, the vending machines were broken. The restrooms for the conference I was at were the stinkiest portopotties ever. I've been in outhouses that didn't stink that bad. I wad guaranteed a rollaway in my reservation but they wouldn't give us one citing fire concerns. I have been at much smaller marriots and always gotten a rollaway no problem. I also wasn't impressed with the service at all. Oh yeah and parking at night was bad, you always had a super long walk to your room. I am a Marriott rewards guy but nextime I'd probably stay at the springhill suites up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Napa, but eat somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: hotsyd22
Reviews.Content: We picked the Marriott as we were unfamiliar with the hotels in Napa and we got a good deal. We were pleasantly surprised - great location with easy access to the town of Napa as well as the vineyards. The concierge service was excellent and helped to plan our day with some great suggestions. Breakfast at the restaurant was pretty ordinary though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: aaronsangel
Reviews.Content: The good - The king bed was comfortable and roomy. The staff was friendly and helpful. They are going through a remodel, but I didn't notice any extra noise. The bad - The breakfast in the morning was sufficient. The cocktail hour menu was just alright and the dessert bar was laughable and included popcorn and stale pretzels. The business center charges for everything. There is a concierge person who will do it for free, if they are there. The front desk lady was nice and helped me with my needs. The spa - My husband surprised me by getting me a facial. While this was a wonderful surprise and the lady did a good job, it cost more than our room did with a bottle of wine included. I think what he paid for was the look of the spa than anything else. I would go elsewhere for a spa treatment. They were overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls & ceiling but good location.”
Reviews.Author: GLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: The location is good because it's in Napa and close enough to downtown Napa and the wineries. For $150/night it was a good deal as most other places anywhere in Napa are about double the price. Staff was great and wine tasting at night was decent. The rooms were revamped and nice. The only complaint I would have is that I could hear through the thin walls & door. I am not a light sleeper but you really can hear a lot through the walls, door, and ceiling. I was on the bottom floor, so not only could I hear talking, slamming of the doors, but also the heavy walkers upstairs. In terms of noise, I would give it 2.5 stars. For overall value I give it 4 stars just based on location versus price. I would also stay again for the same price but next time bring my ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: stevedosi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 days surrounding a professional meeting. The front desk and concierge staff were all eager to please and make our stay as comfortable as possible. The rooms are large, equipped with a safe and empty mini-fridge. The conference facilities were top notch. The gym was undergoing renovation, but still accessible. My wife enjoyed the spa and massage. The hotel is nicely located for travel through the valley or to go to Sonoma. Very close to the hotel is a Whole foods, Trader Joes and inexpensive dining options.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT valentines day getaway and goernment employee discount!!”
Reviews.Author: LarBearSSF-CA
Reviews.Content: Two valentines Ghiradelli chocolates on the bed for my wife and I!! We got this place on a STEAL for a Napa Valley high end hotel!!! If you work the CA or federal government, reserve directly through the Marriott website. I booked this 2 days before valentines day and by some miracle, we got it for less than $95!!!! We are members, so we did get free concierge access, so if you are a member and don't get it, it won't hurt to ask.... Great location, wine, service. Parking is tough since it's a wraparound parking lot, so if you don't mind walking, be back late. We didn't have the greatest experience in the restaurant on Valentines night, extremely slow service and understaffed for a "holiday" night, but otherwise, i would completely recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK. Leave fan/heat air on to mask constant door slamming/hallway noise”
Reviews.Author: bikinghiking123
Reviews.Content: Staff and room are ok. Average for Marriott. Free wine tasting in the evening. Major minus: the first night was constant door slamming/closing and people chattering in the hallway. We figured out that leaving the air control system on helped immensely. Easy location for Napa Valley wine tasting.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok, Hotel great, Service is top notch”
Reviews.Author: Tigereyes69
Reviews.Content: The first thing you should know is that this is NOT a quaint hotel in the beautiful rolling vineyards of Napa Valley. It is off the Hwy, across from a Target shopping center, surrounded by older homes. It can be a little disappointing at first. However, the hotel is great and the staff are excellent. We were upgraded to a Jr Suite (1 king, 1 sofa bed) with kitchenette/patio and we paid for concierge services, which is, appetizers and wine from 5:00 - 7:00, dessert bar at 8:00, continental breakfast in the AM. The bed was comfortable, the couch was not so hot, but it is a sofa bed so you can't expect much. The conceirge buffet is Ok. You get wine/soda/water, cheese, fruit, bread, and some type of hot tuna appetizer. The dessert "bar" is simply cookies and some candy. Get there as soon as you can because the food goes quick and they don't re-stock very quickly if at all. Breakfast is fine. There is a sports bar and restaurant on site, a nice 24 hr gym, a pool/jacuzzi that stays open until 11:00pm. The pool is a strange S shape - don't plan on doing laps. The Spa is adjacent to the hotel and you have to walk outside to get there. It was wonderful but remember, you are in Napa so you will pay premium for spa services. The staff at the Spa were great also! This location is about a mile from the Napa premium outlets and very close to downtown Napa where you can find great restaurants, the opera house, etc. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very acccommodating hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerlpl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel this past weekend with a group of friends to celebrate a friend's 50th birthday! Found a great deal on travelzoo.com for $99 to include 3 wine tasting passes for 2, 3 free l/2 bottles of wine (rec'd from the winery), and evening wine reception. I found out the hotel was renovating in the south section where our rooms were located. The north end of the building is considered an "upgrade" because it is already renovated and it offers evening wine & appetizers and a continental breakfast in the a.m. to include eggs (no meat). We called to see if we can change our rooms to the north section since this was a special celebration. We were accomodated by the manager, Tricia. She answered all our questions and was very pleasant when we arrived. We needed to arrive early before the "birthday girl" came to decorate her room and it was ready and waiting for us at 10:00 a.m. Overall, the group was very pleased with the rooms, service, and concierge service. We were even offered more wine tasting passes (complimentary or 2-4-1) by the concierge also. Convenient location off of the main Hwy 29 and lots of parking available. I would definitely go back for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: KonaKoffee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip last week. I was very pleased with my stay. For starters, this hotel is right off Hwy 29 which is the same highway that takes you by all the wineries. Hwy 29 is a straight shot through Napa, Yountville, Oakville, Rutherford, St. Helena and Calistoga so there are dozens of wineries accessible off this hwy. The food at this Marriott was also exceptional and very reasonably priced. I stayed on the concierge level and so had access to the concierge lounge. The concierge lounge was very nice and had free wine and appetizers every night and a hot breakfast and coffee every morning. Only downside to the concierge lounge was that the breakfasts didn't have any meat - only eggs and oatmeal. So if you're like me and feel totally incomplete without some kind of meat for breakfast, you may want to plan to eat in the restaurant. Great parking. Nice bar with great happy hour specials, a pool table and TVs. Also, the Napa Valley Outlets are one exit down from the hotel. This was just overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good wine tasting location”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 1/09/2010. We went wine tasting and out to lunch in the wine country.The hotel is in a good location for everything. I would suggest driving to calistoga in the morning and work your way back to the hotel. The traffic gets very busy in the afternoon going north with wine tasters.We avoided most of the traffic by starting in calistoga and driving back to napa. Have breakfast in calistoga at one of the restaurants or coffee shops even get a massage at one of dozens of spas and wine taste your way back to napa. I would recommend Charles Krug winery the oldest winery in the valley. We had drinks at the sports bar in the hotel, they have a happy hour every day with good deals on drinks. The bar is a little too bright and generic but fine for a drink or 2. We had dinner down the street at the Tancas steak house a 5 minute drive. The steak house is a local hangout and we were seated in the Bar area which was fine. If we wanted to wait we could have eaten in the restaurant side. I had the short rib which is the best i have ever had and my wife had the new york steak which was cooked perfectly. The service was a little slow but very friendly. I think they were short staffed the night we were there. The price of the food is very reasonable for the napa valley ,dinner for two with a bottle of wine and 2 drinks under $100.00 with tax and tip. We ate brunch the next day at the sports bar in the hotel and the food was good and reasonably priced for a resort hotel.I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...not great”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our wine trip because I am a Marriott memeber and used points for a portion of the stay. The hotel is ok....nothing great. The rooms is ok, bathroom small. Everything seems a bit dated in this hotel. We used the concierge once to get us a cab downtown to napa and to recommend a restaurant. The concierege was very helpful and I used her several times during my stay. If you get a good rate this is not a bad place to go, but this is a very basic marriott. But if I were to do it again, I would stay somewhere with a little more character and actually stay in Sonoma (it is prettier).

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: JB2go
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at some of Marriott's finest hotels, and although we knew this one wasn't in the high-diamond range, we expected better. Why is it that the highest-priced hotels offer the fewest amenities? No breakfast, no free Internet, etc. All that would still be OK if the service and room matched the very high quality I associate with the Marriott name.

Reviews.Title: “typical Marriott- good service & rooms, above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeER
Reviews.Content: At most Mariott's you know what you will get- good rooms & service, safe location & that is exactly what you get here - no surprises. Sometimes that is exactly what you are looking for & comfort is a big factor in choosing a hotel. We have stayed here before a number of times & will continue to do so again. However, we do not feel it is the best full service Marriott we have ever stayed in- but above average Pluses: good location to tour Napa knowlegable staff nice renovated rooms great concierge lounge discount coupons to wineries negatives no restaurants within walking distance of hotel although close to Trader Joe's & Whole Foods spa overpriced but hey this is the Napa region where a lot of things are overpriced gym in separate building so you need to walk outside to get to it- difficult when it was 20 degrees at night as when we were there. pool & jacuzzi outside- unusable in December when the high was only in the 40's. parking lot small so it would be hard to get a spot when it's crowded- you pay have to park far away. All in all, IF you get an upgarde to use the concierge lounge it would be definitley worth it- it's one of the better lounges we have visited & we Always stay at a Marriott. The evening appetizer was sesame chicken & it was prepared very well. Also free wine, soft drinks, water. The am breakfast was very good also. big tip- the hotel has the name of a store to buy discounted wine at- about a 5-10 minute drive away. The wine there is the best price in the Napa Valley & they have the best prices we have seen in the area- much cheaper than the wineries. One price I compared to the wineries was $5 per bottle less so if you're buying wine, come here. The reviewer who stated NOT to get a room in the hallway near the concierge lounge was absolutely correct- it's definiltey very noisy. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaT2
Reviews.Content: big and clean room. service staff were polite, and there was free wine outside the restaurant from 5.30-6.30pm everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: AshfromBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a terrific stay. The room was lovely, decorated in warm welcoming colours and the linen and cleanliness of the room were up to a good Marriott standard. Service was friendly and the concierge was great and helpful. The fireplace in the lobby is nice and welcoming. Internet was available but you had to use your credit card - this was a bit of a shame as we don't enjoy putting our credit card details on the internet. The breakfast offered in the Harvest Cafe was decidedly average (maybe less than average - fruit wasn't fresh, eggs were cold etc) which is very disappointing as the location of the hotel means that you have no other options. It's only 5 mins away from Evans Transportation Center, which is a plus. There's a little shop in the lobby where you can buy essentials, like bottled water. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “There's a difference between $400 and $175”
Reviews.Author: Travlholic
Reviews.Content: For the price per night that we got, this Marriott was a hit. We rolled up, checked in and found that there was already free wine tasting going on by one of the local wineries. Check in was professional and flawless. The rooms are typical Marriott, but that's a good thing for those who like to know exactly what to expect. The location was on the North side of Napa closer to most of the Napa wineries. We were about to stay at another hotel further up in the valley, but that cost would be about $400/nt. The Marriott is what it is, clean, nice, standard, with a few nice extras....but with the price difference over 3-days we'd rather spend it on a nice dinner, wine, and a hot air balloon ride and still have money left over.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sanetrader
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been better situated unless it would have been on a vineyard. for the price you pay, it is definately a great buy. Easy access to the highway and vineyards. We were just there the week before the crush and found out it was the busiest week of the year to visit. Visited the restaurant for breakfast only. Satisfactory for service and food quality. Did use the concierge service to get some 2 for 1 passes for visiting different vineyards, mostly very helpful. Free coffee service in the morning was convenient. They do not charge for internet if you use it in the lobby area which we did. No inconvenience in this as they have a comfortable sitting area. Missed the wine hour so can't comment. Rooms were fine. Ours was facing out towards the street but we had no trouble at night w/any noise. All in all, an enjoyable visit and worth the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Napa wine tasting and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: CalFanAnn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend in wine country to celebrate his birthday. The Marriott was a great location for driving to wineries. Also, their wine happy hour was nice, especially since it started right after most wineries' tasting rooms closed. Our room was clean, spacious and quiet. I would suggest requesting a room on the second floor, since first floor rooms had sliding glass doors that open into the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, reasonable price, average room & service.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle219
Reviews.Content: Easy access to highway thru Napa. Not as quite as nice as other Marriott locations. If you get the concierge deal, make sure your room is on a different hallway-the room is accessed non-stop because of the good, free food & bottled water-we had to request to be moved because of the noise-I was awakened at 5am. Good option if you don't spend much time in the room and want easy access.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and well priced”
Reviews.Author: Barney1110
Reviews.Content: OK, it's a Marriott, not a special B&B in the Wine Country, but the property is well located and well priced. Staff is friendly and very accommodating. Took exactly 10 minutes for a bed board to arrive after we noted that the bed was too soft for us. Here's the deal on the Concierge Lounge. Join the Marriott Rewards program--it's free. If you haven't stayed 10 days in a Marriott in the year, you can get access to the Lounge for $10--per room, not per person. What do you get? Hot and cold appetizers and wine in the afternoon, dessert in the evening and a hot and cold buffet breakfast in the morning. After a large late lunch and the very generous appetizers and dessert, we didn't need dinner and saved the cost fo

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Wine Country Visit”
Reviews.Author: travelfravely
Reviews.Content: I was in town last week for a wedding in Napa Valley, and booked the Marriott after a positive recommendation from a friend. It turned out to be good advice after all, as I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. My room was spacious and comfy, and we were right next to downtown Napa, and only 5 minutes from great vineyards. I recommend Far Niente if you can get a tour, they had a great vintage car garage that is included with the tour. One great plus about this hotel was the awesome food. It was Kansas City BBQ and it was a great surprise. I am from the South and never expected to find quality BBQ in Napa, but I stand corrected. The Pork Sliders were my favorite, and my wife was a big fan of the Brisket. I'm surprised more places don't offer BBQ in Napa, it was a great bonus to our stay, and we invited friends over from the wedding to try it with us a second time.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was nice enough, the desk clerk wasn't.”
Reviews.Author: GOMichiganState
Reviews.Content: Our initial impression of the hotel was somewhat jaded as the odd woman that checked us in seemed to either not like us or her job. She really shouldn't be the face of a hotel in a lovely area. It was an unpleasant exchange - when we were in the best of moods. The room was fine, the concierge helpful, the location convenient. Could have been soooo much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandcris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got this via P-line for one mid-week night. It's a two story hotel on a sprawling campus next to Highway 29, a few miles north of Napa and 7 miles south of Yountville. Check in was friendly. We arrived at 2:00 and I asked for an upstairs with a pool view. Was told a room would be ready by 4:00. They took our cellphone number and called us 15 minutes later saying the room was ready. Nice large room. Small tub. Very comfortable pillow top bed. Enjoyed a sliding glass door that opens (so tired of being hermetically sealed in large hotels) Quiet. Location is okay, but not within walking distance of anything. Pool is unique shape and pool area was nice. Internet in room is $9.95 but free in the lobby. (This fact isn't well advertised.) We paid a lot even with P-line for this room (Almost 50% more than what we paid for a 4 star in SF the night before.)

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff but just ok”
Reviews.Author: dccnm
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller Marriott and while the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, I was disappointed with the property itself. The room was clean and the size was adequate but it had some weird things about it--the in room coffee maker was in the bathroom (yuck!) and only included coffee for one person, the bed covers were too small for the bed (neither the sheet, nor covers extended over the side of the mattress so you needed to sleep towards the middle of the bed if you wanted covers!), The internet in the room cost $12.95 a day, and while it turned out that there was free wifi in the lobby, that was not mentioned anywhere! I had just stayed at a Best Western in Calistoga a few days before and that room had a microwave, coffee maker that ground the provided beans, cork screw, and wine glasses (this IS after all Napa Valley!) and free wifi. The pool is quite small as well. I stayed at a Best Western in Calistoga a few days before, and honestly, it felt more luxurious for less money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Napa if you're not into B&B's”
Reviews.Author: bruinluvtravel
Reviews.Content: We got a room here from priceline...great deal - awesome hotel for the price! We had a great room. Great service. Good food in the lounge. Location was perfect for visiting downtown Napa & going to the wineries. We celebrated our 4th anniversary with just one night away from our son and this was just what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing girlfriends trip to Napa”
Reviews.Author: KelMarie78
Reviews.Content: I had an awesome vacation with some of my girlfriends this week at the Napa Valley Marriott Hotel. We chose it because we wanted somewhere with a pool and spa that was close to the wineries, and it was ideal. It was only warm enough to hang out by the pool in the afternoons, so we just slept in and did spa services in the morning. The pool was pretty and clean and the chairs were comfortable. At the spa, I had a massage, facial, and manicure - all were great. One of my friends also had a pedicure that she liked a lot. One very cool thing about the spa is that they had a women’s “wet room” area with a eucalyptus steam bath, vichy rain shower, and Jacuzzi. Very relaxing. We also hung out in the spa lounge area, which was a peaceful place to sit in front of the fireplace and sip wine after our treatments. Oh yeah, there is also a fitness center, which looked nice, but none of us worked out while we were there. We ate at the hotel a lot because we were told they had a great chef, and the food was ideal because there was a lot of variety. We ate at the regular restaurant (Harvest Café) and the outdoor bar and grill, and both had healthy and “indulgent” options, and none of it was too expensive. I’m a healthy eater but some of my friends aren’t, so it was good that there were both types of food. I actually didn’t even gain weight on this vacation despite all the wine! Anyway, we had breakfast one day in the concierge lounge, and it didn’t have a huge selection, but it was free and good. We didn’t have room service except for dessert one night, which was chocolate cake (yum!) but I’m sure it’s good. Also, we did the complimentary wine tastings in the lobby every night and it was great to drink (free) wine and meet other people in the hotel. So speaking of the wine (our main reason for coming) we spent almost a full day going to different tasting rooms. My favorite was definitely the Castello Di Amorosa. The wine was great there, but the really cool thing is that it’s in an amazing medieval castle. We didn’t do the guided tour or anything, but the parts that we were able to walk around in were incredible. I also really liked Rombauer Vineyards. It was a very friendly place with gorgeous trees and flowers and yummy wine. The winery tastings vary in price, but most of the ones we went to were between $10 and $20. Okay, back to the hotel. We had a suite with a living room and a separate bedroom with two beds. There was also a patio overlooking the garden area, and we had coffee out there every morning. We didn’t hang out in the room a lot, but it was definitely nice and had plenty of room for 4 people. The beds were especially comfortable and had TONS of pillows. All in all, this was seriously a PERFECT vacation. No complaints at all! I think we are going to make this an annual girls trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing visit. Just what the doctor ordered.”
Reviews.Author: Bryan2403
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little hesitant about this hotel due to all the mixed reviews but it turned out to be a great stay for me and my wife. I'm 30 and she's 29 and we were just looking for a nice relaxing place to stay and great wine never hurts. Hotel was in a good location close to restaurants and wineries. Pool was on the smaller side but very nice, never got extremely busy. Rooms were nice, big, and clean, bed was absolutely FANTASTIC. Upon checking in our room was upgraded to a garden view room we had a nice little patio just outside of the pool that was perfect after a long day of running around. Greg at the front desk was a wonderful host and wealth of information from dining to restaurants to everything in between. Overall our two night stay was very nice and exactly what we needed. We booked the room through Priceline for $85 and it was definetly worth it propbably would have given four stars if we paid full price.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless-Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaStephanie
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late. Check in was fast. Our room was spotless. I am very picky and look for anything not clean. Bathroom was white, bright, sparkly and clean. The room was large. Parking is free. And it is easy entry to Hwy 29 and the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place for a wedding...”
Reviews.Author: haha_no5
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not understand how to handle groups. I had to alter my reservation several times in order to ensure that my friends (the Bride and Groom) would not be charged for having an empty (and overpriced) room. I found great deals for this place on several websites, so I was baffled when they said my AAA discount and discount rates from expedia and hotels.com were not valid if I booked with the wedding party's blocked off rooms. So I had to pay an extra $65. I asked what came with that heavy price increase, and I was told there would be a meal provided at the hotel and a shuttle to the wedding. Well, there was no meal - just instant coffee in the rooms. The shuttle we took was provided for by the Meritage Hotel, where the bride and groom were staying. I complained and was apologized to because they had mixed up wedding arrangements. However, there was no credit or refund. DO NOT HOST A WEDDING AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: G0Terps
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good size and the beds comfortable. Request a Courtyard view otherwise you'll be looking directly at the parking lot. The fitness room is dated. The pool and jacuzzi are relatively small for such a large hotel. And, the reception on the flat screens is bad (no HD and grainy picture quality). It's a large sprawling two story roadside motel style lodging where you enter and exit the building near your car (assuming you can find a space on your side of the building). The rooms are comfortable though, so if you're looking for a good night sleep, you can get it here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but you need to do the work”
Reviews.Author: jkb08
Reviews.Content: We booked online at Marriott and found that you cannot request a particular room type. You get either king or double, no guarantee. We called the hotel and got the same information, but a helpful clerk who recommended that we request a garden view with a patio. This is a two-floor facility and the road is nearby. I booked online eventually, placing that request in the comments section, as advised. I also used the e-concierge when they sent me my confirmation, asking for robes, extra towels. When we arrived, the desk clerk was surly, but gave us a king room with a garden view and patio. No one ever mentioned that there is a concierge level (which we would have qualified for without expense). None of the e-concierge requests were in the room. We had only two towels total and no soap and had to call housekeeping just for basic supplies. The room is nice and comfortable - not large. The walls are thin and the neighbor's TV woke us at 2 am. All in all, the location is convenient, the room itself adequate, the service was seriously lacking. We had to dig for the information we got.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location. Will come again.”
Reviews.Author: PD2K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay in high end hotels/B&B's while in Napa Valley. However the problem is we never get to enjoy any of the hotel's grounds, amenities, tastings, etc. since we always spend all day out wine tasting, dining, etc - we simply just go back to the room to sleep. Since this is always the case, this time we decided on trying a more budget friendly hotel. After researching, we decided on the Marriott. It's not a five star hotel, but it really does the job. I have to say, I was very pleased with my stay. It's conveniently located near both Highway 29 and the Silverado Trail. We stayed in the concierge level - which includes access to the concierge lounge. The room was very pleasant with a garden view, desk, coffee machine, and flat screen TV. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a good size with Bath and Body Works toiletries. When staying in the concierge level, you get complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine tasting in the concierge lounge. The breakfast was good - scrambled eggs, hot/cold cereal, fruit, bagels and yogurt. The afternoon wine tasting is plonk and should be avoided. Also it's near Stagecoach Shipping, so it's easy to mail back the bottles you purchased. Apparently there is a spa in the hotel, but my wife never used it - we're too busy tasting great wine. If you're looking for Frette sheets and Molton Brown toiletries, then this hotels is not for you. But if you are looking for a good hotel at a good price, with a great location, then this is right for you. Seriously, is anyone ever in the hotel while in Napa...save your money for the French Laundry. The Marriott may not be high end, but I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PopsicleToes4u
Reviews.Content: We left Stevenswood in Little River, CA with a bad taste in our mouth with NO expectations for this Marriott. We were so happy and surprised! Our room was large and comfortable. It had an ion hair dryer, great water pressure, great linens and lots of perks. The staff is open and friendly and seem genuinely happy to see their guests. The only disappointment was the bar. It is also a sports bar/cafe, bright cafeteria style room. Was hoping to have a couple of drinks in a real bar - but we got our drinks to go, because of the food smell in the room. Not really conducive to what we were hoping for or expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, comfortable and cozy!”
Reviews.Author: 2Shishis
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here 1 night on our way into Napa. We had just come from a 5 days business trip in the city and I was looking for a place to go do some laundry. This Marriott has a laundry room and they don't rip you off ($1/wash $1/dry). The sports bar allows you to bring in your own wine and no cork fee! The appetizers were outstanding and the staff were friendly and accomodating. My friend had a cold and commented that the tissues were full sized and not the cheapo little ones! The courtyard was lovely and we sat outside during the complimentary wine tasting. The wine wasn't that great but it was free! I would say that this is a wonderful, clean place to stay. I highly recommend it! We would gladly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not upscale but just right”
Reviews.Author: Akgambler
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time staying here, and this time we came with 3 other couples for my 50th Bday party. We stayed in the concierge rooms on the garden side. When we first arrived there was a glitch - some rooms were facing the parking lot. Front desk was VERY unhelpful, but Manager Jamie straightened it all out and without much prodding. The lobby is comfortable and inviting, the garden/terrace area is very nice. We had a suite and loved our room! Nice appointments. The regular rooms have a little bit smaller bathrooms which I didn't care for. But Marriott beds are just spectacular! The concierge room is nice but is way too small for the number of rooms that have to be accomodated. The location of the hotel is just right, with everything you want to see nearby but not right in the middle of the winery traffic. I'd stay here again. It isn't like a cozy old inn with character, but it is comfortable and fun.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: happyrobot
Reviews.Content: It's a Marriot. It's not sexy and exciting. But, it was very clean. The bed was perfect and the room was quite roomy, livable, and quiet. I enjoyed my short stay there. Also, I somehow scored a really good rate here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofcabo
