The breakfasts were lovely and all the staff were so polite and helpful. The swimming pool area was nice and just what you need after a hard day wine tasting. We also had a couple massage which was absolutely fantastic and the best massage i've ever had! The location is also perfect for trying out the local wineries. Napa was actually one of my favourite places in our tour down the west coast of America!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base location for Napa Wineries”
Reviews.Author: Natalie732
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Valley Marriott from 8/30/2005 to 09/05/2005 in Room 2009. We got the room on Priceline for $122/night. (For Priceline, check Napa and 3 star hotels - it'll bring up the Marriott and the Embassy Suites). The hotel was a typical Marriott - sort of reminded me of a Courtyard by Marriott instead. But it was a great base location for touring the Napa wineries. All we were interested in was a place to leave our clothes, take showers and sleep. We were not looking for charm. But the hotel was nice. It's located across the street from a shopping center - Target, Ralph's Supermarket, Longs Drug Store, etc. Since we forgot a few things for the trip, it was convenient to have these stores a few minutes away. The hotel offered bottled water in the room for $4.50 so we ran over to Ralph's and picked up a 12 pack of Poland Spring for $4 instead. We had a few breakfasts at the Harvest Cafe. We opted not to take the breakfast buffet for $14.95 since we were able to get a 2 egg breakfast, breakfast meat, hash browns and toast or English muffin for $9.95. The extra $5 would have gotten us cereal and fruit which we wouldn't have eaten anyway. The last few mornings, we ran out to the Jack In The Box and grabbed breakfast sandwiches, coffee and orange juice for $6/person. There are two coffee places across the street as well that seemed to be pretty popular with the locals but I never went to either one. The Characters Sports Bar was a good place to hang out and grab some pub grub and drinks. We hung out there one afternoon while waiting for our laundry. The guest laundry was $1 per load and $1 for 45 minutes of drying. The detergent and dryer sheets were complimentary from the front desk. Since we were heading out for the second leg of our trip and were all wined out, we decided to lay low and wash clothes. I never noticed any noise from other doors in the hallway - it might have been because we had the TV on or we're just not that sensitive to noise. We also used the stairs a lot since the elevator was really slow. By the time the doors opened, closed and started for the second floor, we were already up the stairs and walking towards our room. The one thing I did notice was that the hallways were really long. It sort of reminded us of The Shining where Danny rides his Big Wheel down the halls! But since our room was 2009, we were closer to the stairs and elevator. Because our stay coincided with Labor Day weekend, the hotel was fully booked. Parking was a bear! If we weren't back to the hotel by 7pm, we had to park on the other side of the building and walk back to our entry door. There are several keycard doors around the building that will let you back into the hotel so you never had to walk to through the lobby. On a side note, we decided to get massages over at the Amadeus Spa. I thought the facilities were nice - plenty of towels, nice robes, plenty of water, free steam and hot tub. The massage therapists were great and adjusted their massages to what we wanted. It was a nice way to detox after a few days of serious wine tasting. The only major problem we had was with the shower in the room. After adjusting the water temperature, after about 3 minutes, the water would get scalding hot and then it would get freezing cold. There was no way to control it. I thought it was because we were taking showers at odd hours (3pm, 5pm and 11pm) but it happened in the morning as well. I believe I had one shower where the water actually stayed the same temperature all the way through. It may have been a fluke but it was really annoying. And the only reason we didn't check out and move was because we had already pre-paid with Priceline. I liked the location of the hotel as well as having the shopping center nearby. There's also a post office up the street - very handy since we shipped clothing home to make room in our suitcases for all the wine we bought! Overall, barring the showers, I'd have to say that I'd go back - it was an excellent base for touring Napa. If you're not looking for quaint and charm, this place will definitely suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and staff courteous. The location is right in Napa so you could drive to all wineries. They had a nice warm outdoor pool and whirlpool and free wine tastings at 5:30 pm I got hotel thru Priceline for $115/night for a Fri and Sat night stay and Internet price by hotel was $249 This is a nice hotel for around $150 in peak times but definitely not worth anymore than that. My only complaints were that the walls are very thin and can hear tv in next room and the room had a very musty odor. They need de-humidifiers in the rooms. Stayed at a Marriott in St. Louis that had these and never had an odor. Ate dinner in Rutherford at the Rutherford Grill and it was wonderful. The ribs are to die for. Also took a ballon ride in Napa and was definitely worth it. We used Balloons above the Valley and our pilot Frank was great.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware ”
Reviews.Author: jcrossSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is like many other Mariotts. It is very well maintained, has an excellent front desk, nice comfortable rooms, etc. For the right price, it is a great deal. But, one must be aware that the rooms have a quater inch gap between the door and the carpet. This, and thin walls, allow you to hear EVERY door close (slam) and EVERY voice in the hall at all hours. This may be an issue if the is a party, wedding, etc. on site. During my visit there were loud drunk people from a wedding party coming and going yelling and slamming doors until 2:00 AM. DO NOT make this a destination hotel. You cannot walk out the door and be in the "charm" of the wine country. It is on an off ramp for Hwy 29. As such, it is a quick, short drive to many places. Based on it's location, howver, you might as well be off a highway in Nebraska if you chose this as a "destination" lodging. Use it as a crash pad that you get for cheap off priceline or hotwire. I paid $66 when the hotel's lowest internet price was $269. Even then, I would have traded a few more dollars for a quiet night of rest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful warm and cozy Marriott in the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: dreamvac
Reviews.Content: After touring MuirWoods and highway 1 and Napa wineries I moved to the Marriott after my first night at budget lodging at the Chardonnay Lodge( see my review) I was looking for a place where I could just relax and unwind before starting business. I arrived at 9am to relax by the pleasant pool before enjoying the spa at the hotel. My room was not ready but I was made to feel comfortable by the front desk who graciously gave me access to the concierge lounge to relax in and they told me to return in an hour. An hour later, I returned to the front desk, was greeted by name and given a room. The room was fine but perhaps not in the prime locations of the hotel. The desk clerk was obviously apologetic without me saying anything and wanted to give a better room but none were available that early. The room was fine with me, I just wanted to be able to check in early. I then proceeded with the spa treatments which were fabulous. The spa is not elaborate, but they provide excellent services with a nice quiet room and patio to relax in. The prices were fair for the services. All the staff at the hotel were so nice. With the concierge room, there is wine and snacks served at 5-7 pm. The wine served was excellent quality and the appetizers were delicious. Then at 7:30 pm desert is served which were warm chocolate chip cookies. For those not in the concierge room, there is complimentary wine tasting in the comfortable and warm lobby. The breakfast in the concierge room was a full breakfast, deliciously prepared. The concierge Matt was very knowledgable about the area and helpful in guiding folks to what they wanted to enjoy. He really seemed to care about the guests enjoying themselves. Everything was done by the Marriott in a first class manner and the service was outstanding and caring. As some of the reviewers indicate, this is not the newest, fanciest Marriott, but the true test of outstanding lodging is the service and care given by the staff. The Napa Valley Marriott excels at warm and caring hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Cozy stay close to downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Feedback
Reviews.Content: This review pertains to our stay in June – 2005. NEGATIVES: [Neg. Item 1] The bathroom did not have a fan. [Neg. Item 2] Phone rates were a bit much – i.e. $1 for any outgoing call (800# & local numbers) and 10 cents for each minute over 20 minutes. POSITIVES: One of my favorite Marriott’s I have ever stayed at. This Marriott is a two story independently owned hotel of the Sunstone Hotel chain and very quaint. Very tasteful lobby. We opted for the concierge garden view and it was so worth it. There are 82 concierge rooms. Some first floor concierge rooms have patios. I don’t think any on the second floor had balconies. Many of the non-concierge rooms on both floors have balconies. Something to consider. The hotel underwent renovations approx. 2 years ago. The carpet in the hall was such a rich looking blue similar to that of presidential color blue. Loved it. As for the room…great. The closet revealed two robes. Nice touch. The closet doors were both full length mirrors of good quality. The bathroom was great too. The countertop was a beautiful black granite. And finally, a shower tub and wall that was immaculate and well grouted. Very clean! Aesthetically pleasing comforter, heavenly bed, and pillows that felt as good as they looked. Complimentary refrigerator and in-room safe. And finally...a Marriott with tasteful wallpaper that was a beige color. The concierge lounge was great. Outstanding breakfasts – hot food as well as breads, fruit, cereals, yogurts. We never made it mid day to see if anything was put out then. After 5:30 – out comes the free wines. That’s right…free. Hot hors'doeuvres. After 7:30 comes dessert. Although food may not be re-stocked after 10PM, the lounge remains accessible by card all night. Complimentary water, soda, tea, and coffee all night. Both concierges (Emma & Matt) were very helpful. Do take advantage of their abilities to make reservations at the vineyards as well as restaurants. And don’t forget – request the 2 for 1 tasting certificates they have on-file for select vineyards. Coupons can be found in the magazines in the lounge. For those who have never been to Napa, tastings are not free at most vineyards. Be on the lookout for hot air balloons near the hotel. Really beautiful. The pool area was small but adequate. Nothing fancy but still good. Complimentary access to a gym facility that looked really modern. FINAL COMMENTARY: I chose this hotel as I try to earn Marriott points whenever possible and it did not let me down. Some rooms that are non-garden can face the road and be a downer. While it is true that a Target is nearby, it’s one of the nicest we’ve ever seen and it’s designed to look like a Mediterranean villa. We would definitely return to this fabulous Marriott! If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. Happy Travels. The world is just a matter of hours by plane!

Reviews.Title: “More than just a typical Marriot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great marriot to stay in. It was clean, nicely decorated and it had a great pool and hot tub. They also offered free breakfast in the morning on the concierge level and a free appetizer/ wine tasting in the afternoon. The food was pretty good and the staff was courteous and helpful. It would have been nice to have free internet access like at other Marriotts in the business center- but I would stay here again. I think it was a great location right on Rt 29 in Napa- close to the wineries. And you have to eat at Mustard's Grill in Yountville - that was one awesome meal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: stitcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napa Marriott having got a great deal on the room by booking through Priceline. The Marriott was nice and the location was great being just off the main Highway. We got a room with a view of the court yard and pool. The hotel and rooms were very clean and the rooms were stocked very well. Staff was very nice. Lots of places to eat near by so that was nice as well. The beds were feather beds which we enjoyed since we have them at home as well. The only thing we found that could be improved was to take care of the wall paper that was coming off in the room. It looked tacky for such a nice hotel. We would stay at the Marriott again if we returned to Napa. Our stay there was very pleasant and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable, but not for those seeking a 'special' trip”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are local and want to get to Napa for a one night stay (many places require two nights on the weekends), book a room here, just be sure to get the concierge club. If you do, I think you might find the following pros and cons. Pros: nice room, good movie selection, nice beverage and snack collection in concierge room, nice breakfast in same room (at least on weekends...scrambled eggs, bacon, yogurt, pastries, juices, fresh fruit), good location, no highway noise (at least in back), very friendly staff, nice-sized bathroom. Cons: a big hotel -- so you will get kind of wistful when you pass by charming inns and such elsewhere in Napa; pretty noisy doors, you hear them open and close as your neighbors exit and enter; don't believe the hype, the mattress is maybe above average for hotel, but not as good as westin heavenly and nowhere close to a truly excellent mattress. But for 200 bucks, it's a pleasant place to stay on a quick trip to Napa. Just enough nice touches to make the price go down easier. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: NikiC
Reviews.Content: Well once again I want to thank the Trip Advisor reviewer's for taking the time to write. The Marriott was clean, comfy beds, good location and their Consierge level was a nice touch all the water & soda you want as well as a fine breakfast. It is no Four Season's and as was stated it was better than expected for a Marriott. The Spa was pleasant and the massuese's were excellent. All in all it was very pricey, we made plans late and I guess they charged us top dollar for the last room ($289.00 excluding taxes etc. so it was slightly over $300.00) For that $ I am sure you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, convenient”
Reviews.Author: My_Pseudonym
Reviews.Content: Great service from front desk staff- I checked in early and I got a room right away, also was greeted with a friendly hello each time I passed by. I agree with the other reviews that it's definitely not luxury but for the price, it's convenient, clean and quiet (perfect if you are visiting for the wineries and other sights and just need a nice bed). Food and spa- ok, but I would go elsewhere (Yountville or Rutherford), as this area has excellent restaurants and spas.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was very clean and the beds and bathroom were great. There doesn't seem to be a lot of hotel choices in Napa and the staff was great so overall it was a good stay, I just wouldn't pay more than $150 for a room. Overall it was a nice hotel. We got a great deal on Hotwire ($130 a night) we got in late and weren't there very long. It was right off the highway and close to the wineries so that was nice. For a Marriott it left a little to be desired. It had an in-room air conditioning unit that was a little loud and I think we may have just gotten a not-so-great room (it was on the first floor on the corner and we looked out at a trash can!) The Raiders had just started training camp and were staying there and it seemed like everyone else was a little overwhelmed with that. The resaturant was supposed to be open until midnight, but for some reason it was closed, but the manager reopened it for us and another couple, so that was nice. We ordered room service the night before and filled out one of the in-room order cards....by the time 10 a.m. had come around and we had to leave for a scheduled winery tour our breakfast still had not arrived, they said they didn't have the room number for our card. So, that was a little annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle”
Reviews.Author: Flyerno.one
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting wine country, the rooms were comfortable, the services were also very good. The Hotel also had a spa, a nice swimming area and a concierge level which was very nice. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Napa area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful and Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: cmarder25
Reviews.Content: This place was i thought at first simple, good savings and just a place to stay, until i checked in. The Front desk Staff was excellent Armando, MaLissa. When we went to our room it was very cute over looking the courtyard with a king bed soooo comfortable. When i talked to a girl named Christina i told her it was our annivarsary, next thing i know she went and brought us Champange and Strawberries. When i talked to Randy he gave us some great dinner suggestions. This whole staff was excellent and i think the staff is what will make me come back. Just an excellent all around stay. Would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property; great linens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice property with swimming pool & jacuzzi. Best feature was the great bed with high thread-count soft sheets and down duvet comforter. I could have slept for a week! Room was exceptionally clean and restaurant was great for breakfast. Got a $70 rate on priceline which made it an even better deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pillows & Down Comforters for a Good Night Sleep...”
Reviews.Author: MomOf4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 11th anniversary and just got back from a 2 night stay at the Napa Valley Marriott. My husband made reservations for us. I had mixed feelings and was a little concerned about the reviews I had read, but upon arrival, all was good. We checked in and the lobby was beautiful. We got our room, and it was Great!! I wasn't sure what kind of rooms we were going to get due to the pictures on the website. Once we got up to our room, it was very clean and perfect for us!! We had the most Comfortable bed ever with all five fluffy pillows and down comforters!! We slept in BOTH mornings. I had read this was not a good romantic place to stay but I disagree. We were with each other and that's all that mattered. Although this hotel did not offer any type of couples/romantic packages, you can be creative and plan something yourself. We saved $$ by staying here and we were able to spend it on other things!! If you are looking for a good night sleep, STAY HERE!! just a note of caution: when your next door neighbors decide to shower it will get a little loud, but no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: fundatty
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Napa Valley Marriott. I was attending a conference at the hotel. The hotel is located just off HWY 29 in an commercail area (gas stations and strip centers). It is an older two story property that has been updated. I had requested a quiet room and I was given one on the second floor that overlooked a courtyard. The room itself was nicely decorated with a confortable pillow top bed. The room was quiet. I ate at least one meal in both restaurants and once through room service and all were just average. I did not use the spa services. This is not the place for a romantic weekend getaway. It is fine for a business conference where you are not trying to impress anyone.
